Job Description:
Test Automation: Develop and maintain automated test scripts and test frameworks to validate software functionality, using testing tools and programming languages such as Selenium, Appium, Java, Python, or others.

Test Planning: Create and execute comprehensive test plans, test cases, and test strategies for both manual and automated testing, ensuring comprehensive coverage of software features.

Quality Assurance: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers and product managers, to identify defects, troubleshoot issues, and verify fixes. Participate in continuous improvement efforts to enhance software quality.

Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines to enable frequent and automated testing of code changes, ensuring rapid feedback to development teams.
Keywords: Test Automation, Automation Developer, Software Test Developer, SDET, UI Automation, Automation Framework, CI/CD, Software Development Test Engineer, API Automation, Quality Assurance

Job Description:
Skills and expertise you ll require
Cucumber
Jasmine Framework
Mocha

Node.js

testing frameworks
Roles and Responsibilities
You re awesome at and will be responsible for
Own the testing and release for delivery of features on the assigned module.
Develop and maintain automation to apply and collect all tests against target releases with minimal human intervention.
Actively participate in design and architectural discussions for the features planning to be developed.
Support Engineering team to design, develop and maintain functional, regression, integration and end-to-end tests.
Triage bugs submitted from users and other teammates, verifying issues and gathering additional details (via JIRA and applicable tools).
Formulate Test strategy for the business and technical requirements, identify testing scope and test case scenarios, defining test data requirements, managing test case creation.
Work with Product Managers on the release and Go-To Market plan.
Document, track and escalate issues as appropriate ability to build effective relationships through partnering and collaboration.
Provide technical guidance and mentorship to a team of SDET and Sr SDET depending on the role you are placed in.
Build and maintain CI/ CD setup for smooth validation and releases.
Work with engineers and product managers to complete product releases.
Monitor product and feature-level quality health metrics (testability, test health, test coverage, etc) and develop tools to monitor health metrics.
Skills Required
Excellent knowledge in testing skills (design test cases, writing test cases, executing test cases, opening bugs, verifying bugs).
Well versed on source code management tools like GIT.
Proficiency working with Automation tools: Selenium, Rest Assured, Karate and build tools Maven, Gradle.
Experience working with any of the mobile automation tools such as Appium, Espresso, XCUI etc.
Experience in any of Databases/ Caches such as Elascticache, Elasticsearch, MongoDB, PostgreSQL.
Understanding of Performance testing and Performance related tools such as Gatling/ Locust.
Hands on experience in development of test automation tools/ frameworks in an Agile development environment.
Good with coding, oops concepts and proficient in any coding language such as Java, python or Javascript.
Worked on CI/CD setup such as Jenkins, goCD, gitlab pipeline etc.
Proficient in any cloud-based testing platforms like Saucelabs, browserstack to execute automation tests for various devices.

Job Title: Senior Automation Test Engineer | Dutch MNC | DevOn Softwares
Job Description:
Job Responsibilities:
Develop long term strategy for our software products quality and reliability
Develop and perform software tests to ensure we release the highest quality products that meet client needs
Deliver E2E (end to end) QA testing across a software stack spanning multiple internal and external systems.
Inject Quality at each and every step of the SDLC
Look for and bring in automation capabilities when it comes to testing
As a Quality Assurance Engineer, you will be responsible for testing features to ensure functionality as well as usability
Participate and contribute in all Agile ceremonies.

Desired Candidate Profile:
6+ years of professional experience in testing enterprise web/mobile applications
Proponent of Shift-left when it comes to software quality
Automation testing experience in Web, Mobile and API testing using one or more of tools like Selenium, Cypress, SoapUI, RestAssured, Jest, Appium
Experience in cross-browser and cross-platform testing
Experience in API testing using best tools for the job
Good fundamentals on relational and NoSql databases
Experience working in Cloud Native applications
Knowledge of all facets of the SDLC including DevOps
Proven background at working on agile development teams (Scrum/Kanban)
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Job Description:
This position is a test role focused on the our Endpoint products within Forcepoint
This is a great opportunity to develop your skills as a QA engineer
In this role you will develop test strategies, execute end-to end customer driven test cases, build networks, develop test automation scripts and work closely with a global development team to deliver high-quality products
This role will be heavy on the diagnostics, manual and automation aspects of quality assurance
Forcepoint is transforming cybersecurity by focusing on what matters most: understanding people s intent as they interact with critical data and intellectual property wherever it resides
Our uncompromising systems enable companies to empower employees with unobstructed access to confidential data while protecting intellectual property and simplifying compliance
Forcepoint is recognised as a Market Technology Leader in Data Loss Protection, CASB, NGFW and Cross Domain Cyber Solutions and is a pioneer in anti-evasion defences and high-availability clustering
The Endpoint team is an essential part of a global team that designs and develops Forcepoint s Windows, Linux and MAC capabilities to scale to meet the needs of hundreds of millions of Forcepoint users
We are looking for a highly motivated, ambitious, independent hard worker who wants to be part of a winning team
This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced tester to work with a strong team within the cybersecurity sphere
Responsibilities:
Develop test plans, test cases, and test automation for Forcepoint s endpoint security agents
Work directly with software engineers both locally and globally to ensure product quality objectives are achieved
Collaborate across site boundaries to share test practices with low level and system test engineers
Configures workstations, operating environments, and the system under test, as needed to complete assigned testing
Setup and maintain test labs for various projects
Perform other duties and projects as assigned
Work closely with a globally distributed group of stakeholders and remote development teams to ensure that all endpoint consumers get high quality components on schedule.
Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor s degree or 2 - 4 years experience
Knowledge in software automation testing or equivalent
Knowledge with JAVA/Python suitable for test automation development
Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins, Artifactory.
Awareness of Cucumber / Gherkin or other behaviour-driven testing framework
Interest in software testing methodology, testing processes, test development, and test execution
Theory in testing API s and Web Services
Knowledge of desktop applications within platforms such as Windows, Mac and Linux.
Experience with testing tools and methodologies including automation frameworks, large data, performance and scalability
OSI layer knowledge to support triage on various layers and protocols
Exposure to virtualization and containerization.
Soft Skills:
Strong communication (written and oral) and teamwork ethic within a diverse team environment.
Self-motivated to research new skills and technologies
Commitment to the broader range of product development goals (teamwork at scale)
Preferred Skills:
Good understanding of setting up automation test infrastructures and frameworks
Knowledge of test automation and CI/CD
Knowledge of testing and debugging kernel and device driver software
Experience with networking and/or communications protocols, especially TCP/IP
Previous experience working in an Agile/SCRUM
Previous testing experience within the security industry
Keywords: Manager Quality Assurance, Linux, Networking, Testing tools, Debugging, Test execution, Windows, Test cases, Virtualization, Python

Job Description:
You will be responsible for software Test Automation framework development for testing the Vehicle Diagnostic products for European market
Work within Agile team to deliver quality products as one team.
Identify test data required to complete the test activities.
Conduct test case preparation and execution via automation or manually.
Perform regular regression run and work with DevOps team to build up the testing pipeline.
Log, track, troubleshoot and escalate (when necessary) issues identified during testing cycles.
Maintain testing evidence for each test as proof of validation.
Evaluate testing effectiveness on client - reported defects in conjunction with root cause analysis and provide improvement feedback in the testing process.
Create automated regression test scripts and conduct regular maintenance.
YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Studies of computer science engineering, Electronics or Electrical Engineering
Very good experience in writing Test automation scripts using C# and maintenance of Automation framework.
Working Knowledge of Linux OS and Operating commands will be good.
Experience working with the continuous integration tools like Jenkins or Buildbot
Experience in testing web-based application using Selenium is an added advantage.
Keywords: Electrical engineering, automation framework, Root cause analysis, Linux, Test scripts, Agile, Selenium, Automotive, Testing

and enable efficiency for healthcare systems, hospitals, and physician practices. With over 30,000 employees globally, we are about 14,000 strong in India with offices in Delhi NCR, Hyderabad, Bangalore, and Chennai. Our inclusive culture ensures that every employee feels valued, respected, and appreciated with a robust set of employee benefits and engagement activities


Job Responsibilities



Responsible for building and maintaining automated testing environment and infrastructure for a multi-platform product that will be used to validate all aspects of product development.
Develop, document and maintain test artifacts like the test data, data validation, harness scripts and automated scripts.
Estimate and develop scalable test cases using .Net technologies in a highly collaborative agile environment with strong experience in C#, Selenium.
Open to run the manual test regression or build verification suite if needed.
Identifies issues, conducts root cause analysis, recommends and implements solutions.
Takes initiative and ownership to drive Automated tests projects and invests in self-development
Execute Benchmark, load, stress, endurance and other non-functional tests. Monitor application logs to determine system behavior. Address all technical issues; facilitate the resolution and follow up with development and other cross-functional departments.
Publish results and receive appropriate signoff. Prepare detail status reports and monitoring of all defects and issues.
Identifying memory leakage, connection issues & Bottleneck problem in the application.
Actively participates in Sprint demos and present their stories worked " .
Job Specification

B.E/B. Tech/MCA or equivalent professional degree
7-10 years of experience designing and developing automated testcases in C#, Selenium WebDriver, Selenium Grid, Rest API, OOPS concept, basic programming
Mandatory experience on automation framework development and maintenance
Experience developing automated test suites for SOA, server API/web services testing.
Exposure to Agile Scrum and associated framework, User Stories /product backlog and TFS / JIRA Usage.
Should have knowledge of API Automation, Postman and JMeter
Experience with source control like Git or Bitbucket is preferred.
Experience in Test Driven Development (TDD), unit testing, regression testing, integration testing
2-3 years of experience in Performance Testing tools usingJmeter or any other standard tool.
Experience in analysis of the CPU Utilization, Memory usage, Network usage, Garbage Collection and DB Parameters to verify the performance of the applications.
Knowledge of Performance bottleneck analysis and fixes
Good to have exposure in one or more Implementation of CI & CD using Jenkins, Dockers containerization.
Basic knowledge of serenity framework
Exposure to Java is add-on.
Excellent verbal and written communication and organizational skills, keen attention to details and multi-tasking abilities
Key competency

Spot new opportunities by anticipating change and planning accordingly.
Find ways to better serve customers and patients.
Be accountable for customer service of highest quality.
Create connections across teams by valuing differences and including others.
Own your development by implementing and sharing your learnings.
Motivate each other to perform at our highest level.
Help people improve by learning from successes and failures.
Work the right way by acting with integrity and living our values every day.
Succeed by proactively identifying problems and solutions for yourself and others.
Keywords: C# Selenium, Selenium Automation, Selenium

Job Title: Senior Software Test Engineer, API Automation
Job Description:
We are seeking an energetic and passionate software testing engineer to help us deliver better product to our customers. The job involves understanding LeadSquared platform, how customers use LeadSquared, and then contribute to ongoing releases by taking full ownership of quality of features being released.
The role will report to Technical Lead.
Key Responsibilities:
You would do both functional and non-functional (performance, load, security) testing and contribute to test automation as relevant. Once release is done, you?d work with QA leadership to analyze how the release went and identify areas of improvement. Our QA team takes great pride in knowing every depth and corner of LeadSquared, and so they are natural sources of knowledge when it comes to troubleshooting customer issues.
Key Requirements:
A model tester with at least 2-4 years of experience in functional and regression testing of REST API & Web Applications and passion for excellence.
Strong expertise in REST API Testing using Postman or a similar tool.
Ability to Automate test data creation and configuration wherever possible.
Participate in test automation code review activities.
Experience with web browser automation
Ensures product quality through effective monitoring of quality trends, test automation, defect tracking, and root cause analysis
 Excellent oral & written communication skills in English.
Ability to take full ownership of features and functionality
 Experience in working directly with customers or support/sales teams in troubleshooting issues
Good to have:
 Ability to execute SQL Queries.
 Knowledge of Cloud and/or SaaS environments.
 Ability to go through C# code and infer logic is a great plus.
Experience with API Load testing
Keywords: Software Test Engineer, API Automation

Job Description:
We are seeking an SDET to join our team and support the Senior SDET in the development and implementation of automated test frameworks for our blockchain API platform. The ideal candidate will have 2-3 years of hands-on experience with automated tests and frameworks for APIs, familiarity with GraphQL, automation testing (preferably python/Go), popular cloud technologies, and have at least basic knowledge of web3. You will fit into this role if you have an eye for delivering high-quality, high-performance & scalable software driven by automation.
Responsibilities
You will assist the Senior SDET in ensuring the availability and reliability of our platform by implementing automated tests that run 24/7.
Assist in writing and performing functional, system, performance, and scale tests.
Support the maintenance of the Automation Framework and execute the Automation suite, reporting the results to all stakeholders.
Assist in debugging and reporting test failures, and help identify the root cause of failures whenever possible.
Contribute to setting cross-functional product testing standards.
Ensure all test results are properly documented and capture all relevant information.
Support the bi-weekly software development release cycle, ensuring proper testing is completed on new releases in a timely and accurate manner.
Own product features end-to-end beginning with testing, automation, script error-free run in regression testing, and handling any related customer issues.
Requirements
To be successful in this role you should have experience working in a fast-paced startup development environment.
Proficiency with Python/go, Postman, GraphQL
Have a working knowledge of how services are deployed/running on the cloud like AWS/GCP
Sound knowledge of Blockchain. What is it and how does it work?
Sense of ownership, passion to build, support, and maintain quality products on a massive scale in a collaborative, agile environment, and excitement to learn.
Bonus: Experience with Ethereum EVM technologies
Where
We are a distributed workforce enabling everyone to find a work mode that is best for them! However, the preference is for India IST timezone.
Benefits
Flexible vacation policy
Competitive Salary
Company stock options
Keywords: automation framework, Automation testing, GCP, Debugging, Cloud, Agile, Regression testing, Product testing, Python, Testing

Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled Product Engineer with expertise in Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) practices to join our team
As a Product Engineer - SDET, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and executing automated tests to ensure the quality and reliability of our software products
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product managers, and quality assurance engineers, to deliver high-quality and robust solutions that meet customer needs and business requirements
Responsibilities
Test Automation Development: Design, develop, and maintain automated test frameworks, test suites, and test cases using industry-standard tools and technologies.
Test Planning and Strategy: Collaborate with the QA team, developers, and product managers to define and implement test plans, test strategies, and quality assurance processes for new and existing software features.
Test Execution and Reporting: Execute automated tests, analyze test results, and report on software defects and issues. Provide detailed and actionable reports to stakeholders, including developers and product managers.
Continuous Integration and Delivery: Integrate automated tests into the continuous integration and delivery (CI/CD) pipeline to enable fast and efficient software releases.
Test Environment Setup: Set up and maintain test environments, including test data, test servers, and test configurations, to support automated testing efforts.
Test Coverage Analysis: Analyze test coverage and identify areas that require additional testing. Work with the team to prioritize and implement appropriate test coverage strategies.
Collaborative Development: Collaborate with developers to identify test automation opportunities, review code changes, and provide guidance on writing testable code.
Performance Testing: Develop and execute performance tests to assess system performance and identify potential bottlenecks or scalability issues.
Defect Tracking and Management: Track defects using defect tracking tools, collaborate with developers to reproduce and resolve issues, and verify defect fixes.
Test Documentation: Create and maintain test documentation, including test plans, test cases, and test scripts, to facilitate knowledge sharing and future maintenance.
Keywords: continuous integration, Automation testing, Manager Quality Assurance, Test scripts, Defect tracking, Test execution, Performance testing, Test planning, Test cases, Management

Job Description:
As a Firmware Validation Test Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the robustness and performance of our firmware for a variety of products. You will work closely with the firmware development team to design, implement, and execute comprehensive validation test plans. Your work will contribute to the delivery of high-quality products that exceed our customers expectations.
Key Responsibilities :
Test Planning: Collaborates with cross-functional teams to create detailed test plans, focusing on firmware validation for IoT Devices, EDC, NFC, FastTag, Bluetooth, and microcontroller-based products.
Test Development: Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts and frameworks to validate firmware functionality across various embedded technologies.
Test Execution: Execute test cases, identify issues, and report defects promptly. Work closely with developers to ensure timely resolution of identified problems.
Regression Testing: Perform regression testing to validate that firmware updates or changes do not adversely affect functionality across the range of embedded technologies.
Performance Testing: Conduct performance and stress testing to assess the capabilities and limits of firmware in different use cases.
Test Environment Setup: Set up and maintain test environments and testbeds to simulate real-world usage scenarios for IoT Devices and embedded products.
Documentation: Document test procedures, results, and identified issues systematically and comprehensively.
Collaborations: Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including firmware developers, hardware engineers, and product managers, to align on firmware validation goals and priorities.
Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements in firmware validation, test automation, and testing tools.
Key Requirements :
Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical/Electronics Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Years of experience: 6-10 Years - proven experience in firmware validation and testing, with expertise in IoT Devices and multiple embedded technologies (EDC, NFC, FastTag, Bluetooth, microcontroller-based systems)
Familiarity with wireless communication protocols, MQTT and IoT (Internet of Things) devices.
Strong programming and scripting skills (e.g., Python, JAVA, C/C++) for test automation.
Familiarity with audio processing, speech recognition, and audio testing.
Experience with test automation frameworks and tools.
Knowledge of hardware-software integration testing.
Excellent problem-solving and debugging skills.
Strong communication and teamwork abilities.
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.
Keywords: Computer science, C++, Bluetooth, Testing tools, Debugging, Performance testing, Regression testing, Firmware, Financial services, Python

Job Title: Lead Software Development Engineer in Test

Our ideal candidate would collaborate with developers, product managers, and engineering managers to understand features and their implementation details, understand customer usage models, and then develop and execute automation strategies and plans.

youll have the freedom and encouragement to experiment and innovate, to improve existing processes and invent new ones, and not be limited by that s not how we do things here. You ll have a tangible impact on quality, process, our product, and -- most importantly -- our customer

7 + years of proven experience as an SDET
Great programmer in programming languages like Java/Javascript/PythonGreat understanding of Microservices, RESTful architecture, APIs, HTTP & HTTPS protocols

Experience with using Agile development methodologies
Experience using Postman, RestAssured, and automated API testing
Experience designing & executing load/stress and performance testing
Demonstrated experience in measuring and reporting quality-related metrics to identify trends and proactively solve problems
Strong experience with QA methodologies and software testing techniques and tools
Demonstrated experience in automation strategy implementation, planning, and automation framework design
Experience using test cases & test execution management tools (like TestRail), issues management tools (like Jira or Redmine), and development environments (like Visual Studio, IntelliJ, or Eclipse)
Experience working closely with development and business teams
Great oral and written communication skills

Job Description:
Test Planning: Developing and implementing test plans that outline the testing scope, objectives, and strategies for various software components or features
Test Case Design: Creating detailed test cases and test scripts based on software requirements, user stories, and design specifications
Test Execution: Executing test cases to identify defects, issues, and deviations from expected behavior
This includes manual testing as well as automated testing where applicable
Regression Testing: Conducting regression testing to ensure that new software updates or changes do not negatively impact existing functionality
Defect Identification and Reporting: Identifying and documenting software defects and issues, including providing detailed information for developers to reproduce and fix the problems
Test Automation: Depending on the level of automation in the testing process, Software Test Engineers II may be involved in test automation efforts, creating and maintaining automated test scripts
Performance Testing: Conducting performance testing, load testing, and stress testing to evaluate the software's responsiveness, scalability, and reliability under various conditions
Security Testing: In some cases, these engineers may be involved in security testing to identify vulnerabilities and weaknesses in the software's security measures
Keywords: Medical devices, Linux, Diagnostics, Aerospace, Healthcare, HTML, Automotive, Monitoring, Embedded software, Python

Job Description:
We are looking for a Quality Assurance (QA) engineer with 6 + years of   experience to develop and execute exploratory and automated tests(app and API) to ensure product quality.
QA engineer responsibilities include designing and implementing tests,
debugging, and defining corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance metrics (e.g. defect densities and open defect counts.)
The QA technician role is important in our company s product development process.
Our ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before
product launches to ensure software runs smoothly and meets client needs while being cost-effective.
Ultimately, you should monitor all stages of software development to identify and resolve system malfunctions to meet quality
standards.
Responsibilities
Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases
Estimate, prioritise , plan, and coordinate testing activities
Design, develop and execute automation scripts using open-source tools
Identify, record, document thoroughly, and track bugs using tools like Jira
Perform thorough regression testing when bugs are resolved
Develop and apply testing processes for new and existing products to
meet client needs
Liaise with internal teams (eg developers and product managers) to
identify system requirements
Monitor debugging process results
Investigate the causes of non-conforming software and train users to
implement solutions
Track quality assurance metrics, like defect densities and open defect
counts
Stay up-to-date with new testing tools and test strategies
Requirements and skills
Proven work experience in software development life cycle
Proven work experience in software quality assurance
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes
Experience in writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases
Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing
Hands-on experience with automated testing tools
Solid Knowledge of SQL and scripting
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process
Experience with performance and/or security testing is a plus
Keywords: Automation, Agile scrum, Debugging, Manager Technology, Open source, JIRA, SQL, Testing

Job Description:
The senior Software test engineer will be responsible for software design and development activities of complex electro-mechanical medical devices
The engineer will be a part of a small but a highly professional and geographically distributed Software team
A Day in the Life
Test execution and document software using manual and/or automation methodologies.
Thoughtfully develop testing strategies and protocols with state-of-the-art software best practices.
Develop test strategies, review test designs, and validate test scripts, verification of software for Surgical Robotic Medical System.
Provide support for NPTV (Non-product tool validation).
Navigate the complexities of industry and government regulations to include IEC62304, IEC82304 and FDA QSR (Quality System Regulation) requirements.
Develop, document, and test software to ensure that the software meets the needs of end-users and achieves business goals.
Provide assistance to development teams.
Commitment to achieving and exceeding project goals and timelines.
Thrives in working with other disciplines to develop system-minded implementations that consider safety, performance, communication, user interface and other aspects of a final Medical Device product.
Work in a cross-functional Agile team across global R&D teams to test software for new and existing medical device products.
Participate in reviews of requirements, design, implement and test to ensure quality standards are met.
Analyze unexpected, undesirable, or non-understood behavior in software and in interactions of software with hardware.
Document results of defect analysis.
Follow the IEC 62304 standard and project documents such as the software development plan and coding standards.
Participates in other quality assurance functions, including, but not limited to, static code analysis, risk/hazard analysis, and test automation development.
Should be an excellent team player with good communication skills.
Should meet key business KPI/project metrices.
Must Have: Minimum Requirements
Test execution and document software using manual and/or automation methodologies.
Thoughtfully develop testing strategies and protocols with state-of-the-art software best practices.
Develop test strategies, review test designs, and validate test scripts, verification of software for Surgical Robotic Medical System.
Provide support for NPTV (Non-product tool validation).
Navigate the complexities of industry and government regulations to include IEC62304, IEC82304 and FDA QSR (Quality System Regulation) requirements.
Develop, document, and test software to ensure that the software meets the needs of end-users and achieves business goals.
Provide assistance to development teams.
Commitment to achieving and exceeding project goals and timelines.
Thrives in working with other disciplines to develop system-minded implementations that consider safety, performance, communication, user interface and other aspects of a final Medical Device product.
Work in a cross-functional Agile team across global R&D teams to test software for new and existing medical device products.
Participate in reviews of requirements, design, implement and test to ensure quality standards are met.
Analyze unexpected, undesirable, or non-understood behavior in software and in interactions of software with hardware.
Document results of defect analysis.
Follow the IEC 62304 standard and project documents such as the software development plan and coding standards.
Participates in other quality assurance functions, including, but not limited to, static code analysis, risk/hazard analysis, and test automation development.
Should be an excellent team player with good communication skills.
Should meet key business KPI/project metrices
Keywords: Medical devices, Software design, Manager Quality Assurance, Surgical, Test scripts, Coding, Test execution, Agile, Healthcare, Hazard analysis

Job Description:
Lead the verification testing effort for Windows-based computing systems software, which is integrated with mechanical and electrical systems.
Work in an evolving, maturing Agile environment as part of scrum team, in consultation with scrum masters, product owners, and developers.
Investigate, propose, and implement new technologies or processes which improve the reliability and efficiency of software testing.
Apply the appropriate standards, processes, procedures and tools throughout the system development life cycle.
Effectively work with individuals from various engineering disciplines in a variety of locations, including supporting Manufacturing in troubleshooting operations through assembly and test.
Provide technical assistance to othr functional departments such as Quality, Reliability, and Manufacturing.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
12+ years of application testing and/or development experience with bachelor s degree in engineering (Computer Science, Software, Biomedical, or Electrical preferred), or 5+ years of experience with additional advanced degree.
5+ years of direct application testing experience, preferably within in a Windows environment and including automation.
Strong experience in technical specification, traceability analysis, and report writing.
Ability to mentor and review the work of less experienced and/or remote engineering teams.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work in a multi-site team environment displaying strong collaboration skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to clearly and concisely summarize complex technical concepts and problems.
DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using Microsoft Visual Studio, Test Manager, Appium, or Squish.
Experience developing test software and automation with C# language and .NET framework.
Experience with security techniques and protocols.
Experience with medical devices or other regular industries, cardiac ablation or electrophysiology products are a plus.
Specific knowledge of FDA software validation requirements and international medical device standards such as 62304.
Keywords: Automation, Manual testing, Agile, Scrum, Windows, Visual Studio, Test cases, microsoft, Troubleshooting

Job Description:
Contributes towards creation of functional requirements and expectations during design, development, and verification phases.
Assist usability team in documenting requirements including user stories with acceptance criteria and testing flow diagrams.
Create, organize, manage, and carry out the execution of user acceptance testing to ensure all use case scenarios are covered and the product meets end-user s expectations.

Integrate Software and Hardware sub systems to perform system verification in various environments including Operating room (OR) and Office use.
Develop and execute VV test plans, protocols, reports, and test procedures. Conduct technical assessment for Design Inputs (DI) resulting in viable verification strategies to satisfy the DI s.

Adhere to internal quality processes and procedures, produce quality artifacts such as verification and validation plans, test reports and other necessary documentation satisfying regulatory requirements.
Develop and utilize new tools to assist in test automation efforts throughout the product development and maintenance processes.
Develop software for product test fixtures and provide documentation.
Identify, report, and track defects found as part of automation and manual verification activities. Participate in identifying the root cause of the defects and offer strategic advice in resolving the same.

Perform code reviews to make sure the code is written according to coding standards and the edge cases are handled correctly.
Collaborate with the electronics lab technicians, mechanical group, electrical group and new product development group in designing/building test fixtures needed for system verification activities. Generate specifications, test plans and test reports for fixture validation purposes and release the same in PLM.
Work within established development standards and methodologies, including agile development. Responsible for delivering a working prototype at the end of a sprint.

Represent the Software test group on all software related testing decisions, acting as the team s representative in cross- functional meetings. Provide inputs on coding for testability, execution of verification protocols, code reviews while adhering to
coding standards.
Basic Qualification:
Education Required
BE in Computer Science or Electronics/Electrical Engineering
Years of Experience
10+ years of experience with a Bachelor s degree
8+ years of experience with a Master s degree or higher
Specialized Knowledge Required
Proficient in scripting and/or programming in python, C++/C# or similar languages
Experience with automated testing environments, i.e., LabVIEW, Visual Studio etc.
Experience in working with LabView Models and Test stand
Ability to read and understand software requirement specifications, detailed design documents
Ability to write software test plans, protocols, unit tests, and reports
Ability to perform software risk analysis
Skilled in the identification and debug of software and hardware defects
Preferred Qualifications:
Software development or testing experience in the medical industry or other regulated industry.
Able to handle multiple tasks/projects and manage priorities.
Strong knowledge of modern, iterative software design processes and development practices including agile and test-driven development.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with business and technical audiences.
Exposure on CI/CD tools and process
Self-motivated with strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently.
Understanding of FDA Quality System Regulations (QSR)
Keywords: PLM, C++, Software design, Coding, Agile, Healthcare, Labview, Visual Studio, Python

Job Description:
Medtronic Cardiac Ablation Solutions (CAS) is looking for a Senior Software Test Engineer to join our RD Organization to support development of formal tests for application software for cardiac ablation systems. The Senior Software Test Engineer will also be responsible for supporting the design of processes and automated test systems to support this effort.
Areas of responsibilities will include executing application software test system design, test requirements, test procedures, manual testing, and test automation in C#. The candidate will propose a mix of manual, semi-automated, and automated testing to be implemented depending on automation feasibility, specific functionality coverage, and program needs. Candidates must be able to plan and organize test cases and strategy, generate and review traceability to design requirements, and develop and review test specifications and test reports in compliance with design control procedures used within the medical device industry. Candidates must be willing to work in a fast-paced environment.
CAS RD seeks candidates who will meet our customer expectations by striving without reserve for the greatest possible reliability and quality in our products, processes, and systems by being accountable, having a voice, and taking action.
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES
The candidate must:
Support the verification testing effort for Windows-based computing systems software, which is integrated with mechanical and electrical systems.
Work in an evolving, maturing Agile environment as part of scrum team, in consultation with scrum masters, product owners, and developers.
Investigate, propose, and implement new technologies or processes which improve the reliability and efficiency of software testing.
Apply the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools throughout the system development life cycle.
Effectively work with individuals from various engineering disciplines in a variety of locations, including supporting Manufacturing in troubleshooting operations through assembly and test.
Provide technical assistance to other functional departments such as Quality, Reliability, and Manufacturing.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS / EDUCATION / EXPERIENCE
8+ years of application testing and/or development experience with bachelor s degree in engineering (Computer Science, Software, Biomedical, or Electrical preferred), or 5+ years of experience with additional advanced degree.
4 + years of direct application testing experience, preferably within in a Windows desktop environment and including automation.
Strong experience in technical specification, traceability analysis, and report writing.
Ability to mentor and review the work of less experienced and/or remote engineering teams.
Ability to work with minimal supervision.
Ability to work in a multi-site team environment displaying strong collaboration skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, including the ability to clearly and concisely summarize complex technical concepts and problems.
DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience using Microsoft Visual Studio and Test Manager.
Experience developing test software and automation with C# language and .NET framework.
Experience with security techniques and protocols.
Experience with medical devices or other regular industries, cardiac ablation or electrophysiology products are a plus.
Specific knowledge of FDA software validation requirements and international medical device standards such as 62304.
Keywords: Automation, Medical devices, Agile, System design, Healthcare, Windows, Troubleshooting, biomedical

Job Description:
RESPONSIBILITIES Design and develop automated tests to ensure software quality. Test planning and test case creation - to develop test cases that are comprehensive, cover all aspects of the software application Test data creation and management Collaboration with development teams - to work closely with developers and other stakeholders to ensure that the software is tested thoroughly and that any issues are identified and resolved quickly. Continuous improvement - to continuously evaluate the effectiveness of the automation process and look for ways to improve the quality of the software products
SKILLS Must Have Previous experience working as a QA automation engineer (2+ YoE). Advanced programming skills including test automation tools and CI/CD integration. Familiarity with programming script languages including Java and JavaScript.
Expertise in Selenium, WDIO, TestNG, Appium, RestAssured and JMeter. Expertise in automating Web, Android and iOS applications. Ability to develop test automation frameworks. Ability to work as an individual contributor. Strong attention to detail.
Familiarity with Git or other version control systems. Understanding of Agile development methodologies. Willingness to switch to manual testing whenever required. Excellent analytical skills and problem-solving skills. Detailed knowledge of application functions, bug fixing, and testing protocols. Good written and verbal communication skills.
GOOD TO HAVE: Airline/Aviation Industry experience
Keywords: Manual testing, Version control, GIT, Aviation, Javascript, Selenium, Test cases, software quality, Continuous improvement, Android

Job Description:
As a Senior Controls Verification Engineer working in the Seaport District of Boston, MA, you will use your broad understanding of software verification techniques for medical or other regulated systems. You will develop strong understanding of the SW Architecture, oversee the test strategy, provide technical leadership in developing, execution and release activities of Software test in compliance with regulatory standards.
As a senior member of the Controls Verification team, you will be a technical leader for the verification of the control software for the instrumentation s robotic subsystem. This involves overseeing a team developing automated and manual tests to verify the sophisticated embedded real-time platform and the instrument control software for the operation of the embedded actuator and sensor hardware. In addition, the role will involve supporting the electromechanical verification of the core surgical instruments, stapling and ligature instruments with the corresponding control software.
Engineers create our market-leading portfolio of innovations. Combine the best of your experience with training and mentorship to move your career forward. If you want a challenging, energizing, rewarding career that changes lives, join us. Help us bring the next generation of life-changing medical technology to patients worldwide. If you are a pioneer and would like to have a big impact into the new world of medical robotics - then come join our team!
Must Have: Minimum Requirements
Bachelor s degree in a technical discipline, preferably controls or robotics related, and minimum of 8 to11 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 6 to 9 years relevant experience
Provide technical leadership for the software verification engineering verifying the functionality of feedback control loop algorithms designed and developed in MATLAB/Simulink
Lead a team verifying controls software for robotic manipulators and surgical instruments
Lead a team integrating and testing new controller designs on hardware and with the rest of the robotic platform
Conduct software and product hardware-in-loop testing and create model and prototypes
Review teammates MATLAB/Simulink models and ensure that all software meets quality standards; prepare and participate in design reviews
Document or participate in the documentation of the software including verification test plans and reports
Lead the definition and implementation of different software testing techniques to increase test coverage in both automation and manual testing.
Understand the technical behavior of the system, architecture, software requirements with an aptitude to identify product defects in all phases of development.
Lead development of solutions that have significant improvements of processes and test development with aptitude for continue improvement.
Work with the Project Management Office to coordinate dry runs and formal verification activities as required
Collaborate with technical engineering teams, mentor junior test engineers.
Nice to Have
Development of verification test methods to evaluate performance metrics of complex, electromechanical medical systems
Proficient use of modeling & simulation software ( MATLAB/Simulink strongly preferred )
Familiarity with multi-body kinematics and dynamics
Familiarity with position, velocity, and torque feedback controllers
Experience with real-time software on microprocessor-based systems and developing software in a Linux environment (Ubuntu preferred)
Medical product development experience including hands-on experience with medical/surgical devices/instruments; familiarity with medical device regulations including IEC 62304
Experience with a big company with matrix structures, having already worked with cross functional teams using Agile/Scrum/SAFe methodologies
Familiarity with scripting language, preferably Python for generation of automated tests.
Experience SDLC process and tools including JIRA, Git, JAMA, Bitbucket(Stash) and Bamboo
Ability to work with QA to ensure testing meets Quality and Regulatory needs.
Ability to manage, track and upgrade multiple hardware and software configurations.
Ability to work with Systems, Mechanical, Electrical and Software engineers when discovering, documenting, and resolving integration issues.
Keywords: Automation, Simulation, Linux, Project management, Instrumentation, Healthcare, Simulink, MATLAB, Robotics, Python

Job Description:
A highly motivated and energetic individual to join our Global IT Connected Care team
We drive software application design, development, deployment, and support for internal stakeholders and external users
As an IT Test Engineer, you will own the end-to-end application software validation and testing process for the IT Connected Care Product Experience team
Responsibilities include defining the test strategy for applications, authoring/executing test scripts that fully challenge defined requirements and managing/tracking defects that come up in the testing process
This role owns the creation of quality test documents in a regulated industry (test plans, traceability matrices, test scripts/results, and reports)
You will be responsible for working with project managers to provide work estimates and status updates and will be expected to work in collaboration with the development team through the development and validation process
The Test Lead is responsible for overall test leadership for the assigned products
This includes planning and coordinating software testing tasks requiring analysis, planning, scheduling and participation in requirements and design reviews
This role is responsible for defining the testing strategy (manual, automated, integration, performance, load, regression), providing test estimates, test plan development, test execution, test status reporting, and test deliverables
This entails working collaboratively with Product Owners and Product Managers to ensure the appropriate testing discipline and adherence to the MSCM framework
Other responsibilities include ensuring accuracy of their team s assigned test scripts during development and execution resulting from using our standard testing tools
This individual also develops respective domain knowledge, educating the Product Teams regarding test standards, test optimization, and overall objective to improve quality, lower cost, and increase speed
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide leadership of the test strategy, test plans, test creation and execution, and the test data
Provide day-to-day governance of the testing resources and their deliverables
Develop and present materials related to testing levels, activities, procedures, requirements, standards, and use of testing tools.
Maintain a deep and current understanding of testing methodologies and best practices.
Be a visible advocate and subject matter expert for the testing process.
Advise, train and mentor users and team members on testing processes.
Experience in Mobile Application Software Quality Assurance with solid understanding of system validation and lifecycle design.
Experience defining a test strategy based on mobile application requirements, may include manual or automation, include API
Integration testing, functional, performance, user acceptance, and regression testing.
Experience interpreting system requirements into test cases that include positive and negative test scripts.
Ability to provide estimates for test effort
Experience creating and executing test plans/scripts/scenarios
Experience working in agile methodology
Strong verbal communication skills with ability to demo system functionality and system defects to project teams.
Ability to collaborate with development teams to clarify requirements and system/application function.
Strong written communication skills with experience authoring quality documents in a regulated industry.
Experience documenting user test scripts to cover end-to-end user requirements (UAT)
Experience logging test results and collecting test evidence.
Experience logging, dispositioning, and managing defects.
Experience working with tools such as Polarion, HP ALM, Postman, Jira,
Experience using automated test tools for smoke and regression testing using Selenium and C#
Ability to facilitate testing meetings, summarize results, issue/defect reporting, maintain metrics and provide go/no go recommendation.
Generate test data for short- and long-term application needs.
Other Duties as requested
Education Required
Bachelors degree
Job Experience
Extensive knowledge of test methodologies and processes
4-7 years testing and application development experience, including providing test leadership and planning and execution
Specialized Knowledge or Skills Required
Solid understanding of quality regulations and testing techniques required for the Life Science industry
Experience with Medtronic s MSCM and system validation and qualification processes
Demonstrated strong analytical thinking, process mapping, process improvement and problem-solving skills
Strong communication skills (verbal, written, influencing groups)
Time management, organizational, influencing, negotiating and leadership skills
Ability to mentor and coach junior team members
Ability to interact effectively with all levels of management
Skilled at developing, documenting, and building the value proposition for standard test processes
High energy and motivation with an ability to adapt to change
Experience with Agile Methodology in a QA Role
Experience with API testing Using Postman or Soap UI
Experience Using Polarion and ALM for test Management.
Strong UI/UX experience
Mobile Apps Testing Experience
Extensive SQL scripting background
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work in a rapidly changing environment
Strong collaboration skills
DESIRED/PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Background in healthcare
Design/development of automated test cases
Generating and maintaining automated testing plan.
Develop, run, and maintain suite(s) of automation tests
Analyze results of automated regression suites and distill those results into bug tickets as needed
Strong demonstrated ability to work directly with technical leads and other engineers
Demonstrate a creative and innovation-driven ability to articulate engineering quality paradigms and patterns
Automation tech script writing experience
Aware of CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment Automation
Experience with GIT and other version control tools.
Experience with SDET, Selenium, Cucumber, Appium for Mobile testing
Keywords: Automation, Mobile technology, Healthcare, Test planning, Regression testing, Application development, Selenium, Test cases, JIRA, Software quality assurance

Job Description:
The Senior Software V&V Engineer, based in Hyderabad - will focus on supporting medical device software testing for the HUGO Surgical Robotic System
The position is a hands-on development & individual contributor role with a dynamic set of responsibilities in a complex software system including test design & development, design of test automation framework, test scripts development and test execution
The developed software, controls hardware devices, such as robotic arms and actuators
The software also interacts with sensors, GPIO devices and other physical hardware, communicates with microcontrollers and with other networked devices through Ethernet-based middleware, fieldbus technology, and monitors/responds to diverse conditions
A Day in the Life
Test execution and document software using manual and/or automation methodologies.
Thoughtfully develop testing strategies and protocols with state-of-the-art software best practices.
Develop test strategies, review test designs, and validate test scripts, verification of software for Surgical Robotic Medical System.
Provide support for NPTV (Non-product tool validation).
Navigate the complexities of industry and government regulations to include IEC62304, IEC82304 and FDA QSR (Quality System Regulation) requirements.
Develop, document, and test software to ensure that the software meets the needs of end-users and achieves business goals.
Provide assistance to development teams.
Commitment to achieving and exceeding project goals and timelines.
Thrives in working with other disciplines to develop system-minded implementations that consider safety, performance, communication, user interface and other aspects of a final Medical Device product.
Work in a cross-functional Agile team across global R&D teams to test software for new and existing medical device products.
Participate in reviews of requirements, design, implement and test to ensure quality standards are met.
Analyze unexpected, undesirable, or non-understood behavior in software and in interactions of software with hardware.
Document results of defect analysis.
Follow the IEC 62304 standard and project documents such as the software development plan and coding standards.
Participates in other quality assurance functions, including, but not limited to, static code analysis, risk/hazard analysis, and test automation development.
Should be an excellent team player with good communication skills.
Should meet key business KPI/project metrices.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor s degree in computer science & Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or related engineering discipline.
8 to 12 years experience in Embedded Software development with at least four years experience in the medical device or regulated industry.
Must Have: Minimum Requirements
Knowledge in C/ C++ software & RTOS in an Embedded development environment .
Experience on both white box and black box testing .
Experience in embedded real-time applications .
Experience in hardware/software interfacing and design issues.
Experience in test automation preferably using Python.
Participate in System design, coordination with teams and internal product management.
Know-how of field-bus technology (EtherCAT preferred) and standard embedded communication protocols (DDS, SPI, I2C, AXI, UART , etc.)
Experience with software risk analysis (per ISO 14971) including software failure mode and effects analysis (FMEA ).
Awareness of Medical Device standards IEC 60601-1, IEC 62304, ISO 13485, ISO 14971, and applicable FDA standards
Excellent debugging skills and problem-solving capabilities
Experience working in a structured software development environment following a well-defined software development process like Agile / Lean.
Must be a great individual contributor and team player.
Must have qualities including being positive, high standards, resilient, open, and creative.
Appreciation of discipline and work required to develop software in a regulated industry
Keywords: Product management, RTOS, C++, Manager Quality Assurance, Coding, Instrumentation, System design, Sensors, SPI, Robotics

Job Description:
The Software Engineer will be a member of the Engineering R&D team working on the software development and support of medical devices. Works closely with other members of the engineering staff to provide technical solutions to engineering problems.
The Software Engineer will participate in the creation of planned documents and validation reports for tool validation activities.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Participates, as a member of software project or sub-project team(s), in the development of software applications for product / test tools
Adheres to defined development procedures.
Generates high-quality work products.
Translates requirements/specifications into design, and ultimately software.
Participates in requirements, design and code reviews as they pertain to software designs.
Participates in other activities, such as performing hazard and risk analysis, reviews of designs and tests, etc.
Functions well in a team environment
PRINCIPAL WORKING RELATIONSHIPS
Reports to the Sr. Engineering Supervisor/Engineering Manager
Accountable to Project Manager(s) for project-related responsibilities
Frequent interaction with team members from other disciplines, particularly hardware engineers, to develop project requirements and other project artifacts such as project schedules. Possible interaction with clinicians, third-party vendors, manufacturers, subcontractors and other users.
Executing Verification and validation testing of embedded, real-time software, including the development of requirements, test plans and procedures.
Participate in Software tool validation.
Participation in quality assurance functions, including, but not limited to, system risk analysis (per ISO 14971), process audits, static code analysis and test automation.
Participating in design reviews and code inspections and will support the development of documentation required for FDA device approval.
EXPERIENCE
4-8 years of experience in validation of non-product software tools.
Experience in Python programming.
Experience of MATLAB and Simulink Models validation.
Working knowledge of Linux or any RTOS.
Preferred :
Create, review and approve all software development documents associated with each phase of software development, including software verification and validation plans and protocols.
Work closely with software engineers
Document errors and anomalies and assist with corrective and preventative measures. Work closely with other Software Engineers to fix bugs.
Knowledge in C/C++ development environment.
Experience with a documented software development processes or familiarity with FDA and ISO standards like IEC 62304 is a plus
EDUCATION
Required: - B.E or B.Tech in Computer Sciences, Electronics or Electrical Engineer.
Preferred: - M.E or M.Tech in Computer Sciences, Electronics or Electrical Engineer.
SHORT-TERM SUCCESS METRICS (6-12 MONTHS)
Demonstrate strong tool validation skills
Demonstrate strong knowledge on tools and technologies
Establish trusting relationship with the team and other stakeholders
Demonstrate problem solving capabilities.
Deliver on project commitments.
LONG-TERM SUCCESS METRICS (1+ YEAR)
Learn and demonstrate Product and Domain understanding
Consistently deliver on Project commitments
Keywords: RTOS, C++, Medical devices, Manager Quality Assurance, ISO, Linux, Simulink, MATLAB, Principal, Python

Job Description:
As a Senior Controls Verification Engineer working in the Seaport District of Boston, MA, you will use your broad understanding of software verification techniques for medical or other regulated systems
You will develop strong understanding of the SW Architecture, oversee the test strategy, provide technical leadership in developing, execution and release activities of Software test in compliance with regulatory standards
As a senior member of the Controls Verification team, you will be a technical leader for the verification of the control software for the instrumentation s robotic subsystem
This involves overseeing a team developing automated and manual tests to verify the sophisticated embedded real-time platform and the instrument control software for the operation of the embedded actuator and sensor hardware
In addition, the role will involve supporting the electromechanical verification of the core surgical instruments, stapling and ligature instruments with the corresponding control software
Qualifications
Must have: Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor s degree in a technical discipline, preferably controls or robotics related, and minimum of 8 to11 years of relevant experience, or advanced degree with a minimum of 6 to 9 years relevant experience
Nice to have:
Development of verification test methods to evaluate performance metrics of complex, electromechanical medical systems
Proficient use of modeling & simulation software (MATLAB/Simulink strongly preferred)
Familiarity with multi-body kinematics and dynamics
Familiarity with position, velocity, and torque feedback controllers
Experience with real-time software on microprocessor-based systems and developing software in a Linux environment (Ubuntu preferred)
Medical product development experience including hands-on experience with medical/surgical devices/instruments; familiarity with medical device regulations including IEC 62304
Experience with a big company with matrix structures, having already worked with cross functional teams using Agile/Scrum/SAFe methodologies
Familiarity with scripting language, preferably Python for generation of automated tests.
Experience SDLC process and tools including JIRA, Git, JAMA, Bitbucket(Stash) and Bamboo
Ability to work with QA to ensure testing meets Quality and Regulatory needs.
Ability to manage, track and upgrade multiple hardware and software configurations.
Ability to work with Systems, Mechanical, Electrical and Software engineers when discovering, documenting, and resolving integration issues.
Keywords: GIT, Linux, Simulation, Test strategy, Instrumentation, Simulink, JIRA, MATLAB, SDLC, Python

Role: Test Automation Engineer (C# TA)

The world never stands still. And new challenges arise every day. With a passion for questioning things, for supplying ideas, and intelligently driving things forward we are helping society move towards a more intelligent future. Be it with technologies that reduce carbon emissions in cities or hyperintelligent robots. This is how we are able, to tackle the most important projects and push them forward together. Help us shape the future.

With our innovative and integrated technology, we support our customers in continuously improving the reliability, safety, and efficiency of products, processes and plants.

Work as a developer in Sinumerik PLC programming

Job Title: Coddle Technologies - Software Test Lead - Manual/Automation Testing
Job Description:
Main Duties :

Organising the team : It's advisable to place individuals with different skill sets into separate groups and assign them roles that lead to the efficient completion of a project.

Planning projects : At the start, highlight the project's objectives, policies and strategies with your superiors. It's also usually necessary to make estimates for acquiring the required resources for running the project.

Monitoring the test process : A test lead supervises team members to ensure the test goes to plan. This requires you to be thorough and pay attention to detail.

Conducting software tests : The organisation's management expects you to perform various tests on software applications and computer systems by finding issues and fixing them to ensure quality control. This increases the probability that the final products are of high quality.

Recognising when test automation is appropriate : Automation is a technique where you instal software that performs special automated testing. Deciding when to switch from manual testing to automation is important to maximise the efficiency of the testing process.

Motivating team members : Part of your job involves building the morale of the assigned group members to motivate them and improve work efficiency. This can yield a higher output and improve the working environment.

Cooperating with management : The organisation's management can play a role in your success. Cooperation with management can take place through regular communication with your superiors so you can achieve their project targets.

Writing reports : As the task continues, you register scheduled reports, sometimes weekly, to the project's supervisors. These reports detail job progression and the acquisition of project resources.

Conducting research : As a test lead, you extensively study new advancements in your field. You do this to make future improvements and maintain the current trend for the organisation's benefit.

- Defining the testing activities for subordinates - testers or test engineers.

- All responsibilities of test planning.

- To check if the team has all the necessary resources to execute the testing activities.

- To check if testing is going hand in hand with the software development in all phases.

- Prepare the status report of testing activities.

- Required Interactions with customers.

- Updating project manager regularly about the progress of testing activities.
Keywords: Automation Testing, Java, software development, test planning, Manual Testing, Selenium, Testing

LEAD TEST AUTOMATION ENGINEER / TEST AUTOMATION ENGINEER
Job Description:
Responsibilities:
1. Develop and execute test plans, test cases, test data, test scenarios, and other testing related documentation based on the requirements and technical specifications.
2. Interpret and implement quality assurance standards and ensure data integrity standards.
3. Plan, develop, execute, maintain, and improve Automated Test Frameworks and Automated Test Scripts for AWS cloud-based Web and Database applications.
4. Identify areas for improvement in quality for systems/applications.
5. Create and maintain libraries and object repositories.
6. Participate in application planning meetings and perform reviews, walkthroughs, or inspections.
7. Execute automated test scripts, record bugs in JIRA within the sprint schedule.
8. Demonstrate the automated scripts to key stakeholders and seek the sign off.
9. Work closely with the Development, BA and Business teams to gather and understand use cases for automation.
10. Proactively raise risks and issues to scrum master and identify the mitigation plan to overcome hurdles and meet the schedule on-time with quality.
Preferred Qualifications:

degree in computer science, Information Technology, or Software Engineering.
8+ years of previous experience as a test automation engineer using Rest Assured, Postman, Selenium/Cucumber or equivalent and other open-source test automation frameworks.
4+ years working as Automation Engineer leveraging test automation solutions for functional and load testing of web-based technologies and databases on-prem and on Cloud.
Key Skills:
Strong understanding of web, mobile, API, desktop, packaged and database test automation technologies.
Good understanding of programming languages like .Net, Java, JavaScript, SQL, HTML, Python, Typescript, XML.
Experience testing web applications developed using Angular or React frameworks.
Experience working with either of the cloud providers such as AWS. Azure or Google (preferably AWS).
Experience in AWS cloud S3, EC2, Lambda, SFTP, Faregate.
Experience in Agile ways of working and using JIRA and other defect management tools like Bugzilla.
Good to have Experience in testing with financial services domain and testing FTP Systems.
Experience working with Linux, SQL, and Knowledge of performance testing tools like JMeter, Gatling etc.
Hands on experience on implementing ATDD/BDD/MDD/ Model Driven Test Automation
Hands on experience with Selenium web driver, Cucumber, Appium, Rest Assured, SoapUI, Swagger, Postman, Protractor, Jmeter, LoadRunner, VisualStudio Load Test, Grinder, Gatling and other industry standard automation frameworks

Experienced in Cloud Testing preferably using AWS DevOps

Job Description:
We are seeking a Software Development Engineer in Test to continue the evolution of our automated tests and make the building of reliable automated tests at Degreed as easy as possible. Our current core test technologies include Typescript and Cypress.io, but we always seek to use the best tools for the job.
Day In The Life:
You will create and maintain automated end-to-end, API, integration, and mobile tests Key role in building and maintaining coded automated tests for various application tiers Collaborate with product owners to ensure tests validate acceptable quality criteria and standards
Work closely with designers, UX, and other developers to gain understanding of new features, dependencies, and technical details
Work closely with developers, product owners, and engineering managers to build quality into the development process
Provide metrics for critical automation development and assist in release readiness discussions
This description reflects managements assignment of essential functions; it does not prescribe or restrict other tasks as assigned and is subject to change at any time.
Who You Are:
You re a well-rounded software engineer in test with at least 3+ years of experience writing automated test code. Experience with Cypress.io would be a big plus.
You are experienced in designing and developing automated tests for modern web and/or mobile applications.
You know how automated tests fit into the broader picture of CI/CD; experience with Azure pipelines would be a big plus.
You are highly organized, detail-oriented, and able to work autonomously with minimal direction.
You are able to develop automated tests that produce consistent and stable results. You are familiar with API testing as well as end-to-end testing.
Keywords: SAN, Automation, Usage, API Testing, Flex, Genetics, Mobile applications, Machinery, Testing, Recruitment

Job Description:
Thoroughly analyze and review the SRS (Software Requirements Specifications)
Prepare / review the SW Test Requirements Specification documents based on SRS
Prepare / review high level and detailed level Test Specifications and Test Cases
Upgrade existing products for Quality and Optimize / Automation of Test Case
Participate in Product design, development and Testing activities and Support Hardware and SW development team.
Support the SW validation team (review of test specifications, issue solving, support test bench preparation)
Meeting the quality Procedure - ASPICE Procedure / Standards for Testing
Keywords: Software testing, Automation, Design development, Product design, Hardware, Test cases, Testing

Job Description:
Design, develop, and maintain automated test scripts using Testim, Jenkins, Selenium
Integrate automated tests with the continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) system.
Collaborate closely with development teams to understand architectural design, and ensure code quality and testability.
Analyze test results, debug issues and work with developers to resolve defects.
Advocate for testability during the design phase of new features or system updates.
Review requirements, specifications, and technical design documents to provide timely feedback.
Perform manual testing when necessary, particularly for complex, large-scale features or systems.
Create detailed, comprehensive, and well-structured test plans and test cases.
Investigate and use new testing technologies and methodologies to enhance our QA processes.
Report bugs and errors to development teams.
Mentor junior members of the QA team.
Who are you?
Bachelor s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
3 years of experience as an SDET or similar role. 6+ Experience as a Software Engineer or QA will be considered
Strong knowledge of software QA methodologies, tools, and processes.
Experience with writing clear, concise, and comprehensive test plans and test cases.
Hands-on experience with both white box and black box testing.
Hands-on experience with automated testing tools, like Testim, Selenium or Cucumber.
Solid understanding of SQL and scripting.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools and processes.
Strong problem-solving skills and detail-oriented mindset.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Keywords: Computer science, Manual testing, Test scripts, Testing tools, Black Box Testing, Selenium, Test cases, SQL, Auditing, White box

Job Description:
The person hired for this role will design, create, and execute software tests and be responsible to plan and coordinate testing and quality activities and support validation activities for HIS software. This position requires knowledge and experience applying testing best practices and experience with testing tools and methodology and ability to work with cross-functional teams.
Primary Responsibilities included but not limited to the following:
Design and develop test scenarios and test cases based on business requirements, technical specifications, and use cases that verify user workflows, functional testing, regression testing, end to end testing, negative testing, defect fixes, and usability
Development of test data needed to meet specifications, clinical content definitions and software implementation design/logic
Execution of manual test cases, analyze testcase execution to identify abnormalities and report defects
Review use case, design mocks and business requirements with development teams and business analyst to understand the architecture and functionality of the application to create test cases
Design test plans, to communicate test scope to product owner and stake holders
Participate in test activities including: Test Planning, Test Development, Test Execution, Test Review, Defect Triage and Test Reporting
Participate in scrum team planning sessions to identify dependency chain and tasks breakdown, provide estimates and outline test approach
Work in agile environment and interact with Product Owner, Business Analyst, and other QA members during daily stand-ups meeting
Work with development teams to investigate and/or reproduce the issues
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelors degree or higher from an accredited university
Minimum five (5) years of Software Quality Assurance (SQA) Testing and/or Validation experience
Experience working with an Agile team using Scrum Framework
Experience testing applications that are implemented using JAVA, SQL, JSON Technology
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with analyzing and working with large sets of healthcare data (claims and billing, healthcare informatics, inpatient and outpatient data) and HIPAA requirements is desired
Minimum three (3) years of experience creating and maintaining a Quality and/or Test Plan
Minimum three (3) years of experience planning and coordinating application testing
Minimum three (3) years of experience working with Quality Test Tools -TFS, Jira, and HP QC
Strong Organizational and communication skills
Strong skills in Microsoft Office programs
Strong skills in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Software Testing Life Cycle (STLC)
Experience with HL7 messages
Keywords: SQA, Testing tools, Functional testing, Billing, Agile, JSON, Scrum, Test cases, SDLC, SQL
