Job Description:
Working closely with cross-functional teams, your primary focus will be on streamlining our testing processes, providing expert guidance to implement effective testing methodologies and strategies, and significantly reducing manual efforts through automation. This exciting opportunity allows you to leverage your expertise in identifying test automation requirements and automating test scripts using cutting-edge tools and frameworks. By embracing this role, you will be at the forefront of driving technological advancements and making significant contributions to the development of innovative solutions in our fast-paced and collaborative environment.
Key Responsibilities
Develop, maintain, and execute automated test scripts using Robot Framework, Selenium, or other relevant automation tools.
Design and implement test automation frameworks and strategies to increase efficiency and effectiveness.
Continuously enhance automation infrastructure, frameworks, and processes to improve efficiency and maintainability.
Develop Automated tests to support system, integration, regression, and End to End testing.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams and third-party teams to support and oversee testing activities.
Utilize and administer test management tools & methodologies for teams to report test progress, test coverage, and defects.
Utilize SQL knowledge to design and execute database queries for test data validation and verification.
Stay updated with industry best practices and emerging trends in QA automation and Desktop Automation testing.

Key Qualifications/Requirements
Bachelor s degree in computer science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
Proven experience as a QA Automation Engineer or similar role, with 3-5 years of hands-on experience in automated testing.
Strong proficiency in Robot Framework, Selenium WebDriver, TestNG or similar automation tools and frameworks.
Demonstrated expertise in designing, implementing, and maintaining automated test scripts.
Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices.
Experience with test & projects management tools, such as Jira, TestRail, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
ISTQB or other relevant certifications preferred.
Experience with performance testing and load testing tools, such as JMeter or LoadRunner preferred.
Knowledge of continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) processes preferred.
Excellent English language skills (written and verbal).
Keywords: Computer science, Load testing, Testing tools, Social media, System integration, Performance testing, Selenium, JIRA, Analytics, SQL

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Test Engineer with a proven track record of excellence in software testing
The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in test planning, test case design, execution, and automation
You will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions to our customers
Responsibilities:
Test Case Design: Develop detailed, clear, and comprehensive test cases based on product requirements, user stories, and design specifications.
Test Execution: Execute test cases across different platforms, environments, and configurations, identifying defects, documenting issues, and driving their resolution.
Automation: Design and implement automated test scripts to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of regression testing.
Defect Management: Manage the defect lifecycle, including accurate bug reporting, tracking, and verification of bug fixes.
Collaboration: Work closely with development, QA, and product teams to understand requirements, identify testing gaps, and ensure the highest quality standards are met.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the enhancement of testing processes, methodologies, and best practices, staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to test cases, test plans, test results, and other testing-related artefacts.
Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Test Engineer or similar role.
Strong experience in manual testing, test case design, and test execution.
Proficiency in test automation tools and frameworks (e.g., Selenium, JUnit, TestNG, etc.).
Hands-on experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Java, etc.) for automation purposes.
Experience with performance testing tools (e.g., JMeter, LoadRunner) is a plus.
Knowledge of software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile methodologies.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Certifications in software testing (e.g., ISTQB) are a plus.

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Test Engineer with a proven track record of excellence in software testing. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 4 years of hands-on experience in test planning, test case design, execution, and automation. You will play a critical role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality solutions to our customers.
Responsibilities:
Test Case Design: Develop detailed, clear, and comprehensive test cases based on product requirements, user stories, and design specifications.
Test Execution: Execute test cases across different platforms, environments, and configurations, identifying defects, documenting issues, and driving their resolution.
Automation: Design and implement automated test scripts to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of regression testing.
Defect Management: Manage the defect lifecycle, including accurate bug reporting, tracking, and verification of bug fixes.
Collaboration: Work closely with development, QA, and product teams to understand requirements, identify testing gaps, and ensure the highest quality standards are met.
Continuous Improvement: Contribute to the enhancement of testing processes, methodologies, and best practices, staying up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies.
Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to test cases, test plans, test results, and other testing-related artefacts.


Qualifications:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.
Minimum of 4 years of experience as a Test Engineer or similar role.
Strong experience in manual testing, test case de
Keywords: Computer science, Automation, Manual testing, Testing tools, Performance testing, Agile, Selenium, Test cases, SDLC, Python

Job Description:
As a Software Development Engineer in Test-I (Automation) , you will be responsible for designing and implementing automated testing frameworks, developing test strategies, and ensuring the quality and reliability of our software products.
You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to identify and prioritize test cases, conduct comprehensive testing, and drive continuous improvement of our testing and automation processes.
This role requires strong technical expertise, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for delivering high-quality automation solutions.
A Day in the Life
Collaborate with software developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand product requirements and translate them into test strategies and plans.
Design, develop, and maintain automated test frameworks, tools, and test suites to ensure efficient and reliable software testing.
Write and execute complex automation test cases, perform thorough regression testing, and analyze automation test results to identify and report defects.
Collaborate with development teams to promote testability, provide input on architectural design, and implement testability features.
Conduct performance, load, and stress testing to evaluate system performance and scalability.
Identify areas for test process improvement, drive test automation initiatives, and implement best practices to enhance overall testing efficiency and effectiveness.
Investigate and troubleshoot complex technical issues, working closely with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
Collaborate with QA engineers to establish and enforce quality standards, processes, and guidelines throughout the software development lifecycle.
Mentor and provide technical guidance to junior team members, assisting in their professional growth and development.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software testing and quality assurance.
Work on new technical solutions to improve automation framework and increase test productivity.
What You Need
Bachelors degree with 1-3 years of experience working as an SDET for business / technology-intensive products.
Strong programming skills in one or more languages, such as Python, Java, or JavaScript.
Extensive experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, BDD, Robot Framework) and related tools.
Proficiency in building and maintaining automated test scripts, test suites, and test data.
Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices.
Experience with continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) processes and tools (e.g., Jenkins, Bamboo, GitLab CI/CD).
Knowledge of API testing tools and techniques, such as karate, REST Assured, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to debug complex issues and propose effective solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Preferred Skills:
API Testing (Rest Assured/Karate)
UI Automation (Selenium)
Strong in Java, Jenkins
GitLab/GitHub
BDD/TDD/Hybrid
JMeter good to have
What We Offer
Industry-Focused Certifications: Meet leading healthcare experts, discuss innovative strategies, and become a subject matter expert with our comprehensive set of certifications.
Rewards and Recognition: Feeling like you re outperforming on your projects? Get recognition for your dedicated efforts and demonstrated work ethic.
Health Insurance and Mental Well-being: We offer health benefits and insurance to you and your family for hospital-related expenses pertaining to any illness, disease, or injury. We also have Employee Assistance Programs (EAPs) to give you 24X7 access to certified therapists and psychologists.
Sabbatical Leave Policy: Do you want to focus on skill development, pursue an academic career, or just reset? We ve got y ou covered.
Open Floor Plan: Cubicles are a thing of the past and to modernize our office space, we have open floor sittings at every office location. Share ideas with your peers and bond better in an open floor office where there are no barriers and you are inspired to be creative.
Paternity and Maternity Leave : Enjoy the industry s best parental leave policy to welcome your bundle of joy and enjoy quality time with them.
Paid Time Off : Maintain a healthy work-life balance and take time off from work to focus on your well-being and big life moments.
Keywords: automation framework, Manager Quality Assurance, Test scripts, Testing tools, Javascript, Healthcare, Regression testing, Selenium, Test cases, Python

Job Description:
As a Staff Software E ngineer in Test , you will take ownership of testing duties responsibilities for specific modules or features
This involves devising test plans and crafting test cases
Your responsibilities encompass both manual and automated testing
Moreover, youll design systems and configurations to manage system load, as well as tackle performance-driven test cases and optimization scenarios
Your role extends beyond just overseeing technical automation; it entails offering leadership and strategic guidance to an automation engineering team
Youll also engage proactively with our developers and customer support teams
Key Responsibilities
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business and technical requirements for automation.
Identify potential areas for automation and prioritize projects based on potential impact and feasibility.
Design an automation framework that meets the technical and business requirements.
Evaluate and select appropriate automation tools, frameworks, and technologies.
Leading a team of automation engineers in developing automated solutions and frameworks.
Write and review code/scripts for automation scripts and workflows.
Propose and implement enhancements to existing automation processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness.
Conduct testing and validation of automated processes to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Document best practices, guidelines, and standards for automation development within the organization.
Mentor and coach the automation engineers, providing technical guidance and support.
Ensure that automated processes adhere to relevant industry standards, regulations, and security protocols.
Monitoring application performance and responding to incidents
Work in a collaborative environment where you regularly pair, plan, and execute tasks as a team and strive to optimize your team s Lead Time, Deployment Frequency, Mean-time-to-recovery, and Change Failure Rate.
Actively participate in enhancing processes by consistently offering improvement suggestions during team retrospectives.
Independently manage your deliverables in JIRA without others involvement.
What you need to succeed
Minimum of a Bachelors degree, preferably in Computer Science, Engineering, Math, or a related field, with 5-10 years of software QA experience and contributing to full product lifecycles.
Minimum 4 years of experience testing enterprise web applications, UI automation testing using Cypress/ WebdriverIO / Protractor / Selenium WebDriver, or any other BDD tools.
Expert in at least one language such as JavaScript, Typescript, Python, C#, or Java. JavaScript and TypeScript is highly preferred.
Designing test frameworks for test automation, test environments
Good Knowledge of Software Development/Testing Life Cycle.
Experience working with Agile and Kanban/Scrum processes.
Experience in test data mocking/stubbing.
Experience with continuous integration using Code Pipeline/Jenkins/Docker.
Experience in automating Python applications. Experience in automating Serverless applications and CDK/Terraform.
Knowledge of white box testing; knowledge of performance, load, and stress testing web applications.
Experience in API testing.
Good knowledge of SQL and writing queries. Experience in cross-browser testing.
Keywords: White box testing, Javascript, Agile, Scrum, Selenium, Test cases, Monitoring, SQL, Python, Recruitment

Job Description:

Access to training and self-development learning platforms with up to 2.5 hours a week of your working hours
We are currently looking for a Senior Software Engineer in Test (m/f/d) to join our Engineering team in our office in .
Our Product and Technology team is autonomous and co-functional, operating in an agile devops environment with a strong customer focus.
 Our product engineering teams target outcomes rather than outputs, using OKRs to deliver our vision.
You will be joining at a growth stage of the business and will be instrumental in improving the current delivery and quality processes, and support your team to deliver high quality and robust solutions for our customers and our business.
Amongst many exciting challenges, you will:
Collaborate with supportive colleagues, sharing experience and expertise, as we strive to deliver great savings to our customers
Tackle highly challenging testing problems that solve real-world needs to deliver demonstrable value using the latest technology
Work in a talented and passionate team, in a friendly and informal environment, spending most of your day writing code or building services to test software applications whilst demoing and teaching others
Be involved in inception to delivery of various features and products on an ambitious and challenging product roadmap on top of a complex architecture which uses state-of-the-art technologies such as ChatGPT
Oversee and review the daily deliverables to ensure compliance with high-quality standards
Conduct knowledge sharing sessions with presentations and exposure to tasks that help practise new technologies
Mentor and share best practice, tools and frameworks with the wider development and quality engineering community
Create and execute a test plan for all our projects and releases
Do technical design reviews, code reviews and provide guidance to developers
Identify risk areas and/or gather requirements
We are a match if you are:
A hands-on Software Engineer in Test with 8+ years of related experience with a Bachelor s degree; or 6+ years and a Master s degree; or a PhD with 3+ years experience; or equivalent experience
Able to code automated test approaches for complex backend applications, RESTful APIs, microservices serverless functions
Strong knowledge of the Javascript tech stack (Node, Typescript, http libraries such as Axios)
Solid experience in implementing continuous integration delivery pipelines (e.g. Jenkins, CircleCI, CodeBuild, CodePipeline, GitLab Runners)
Exposure to various automation frameworks and end-to-end testing techniques (e.g. Cucumber, Selenium, WebdriverIO, Cypress, Puppeteer, etc)
People skilled when working with developers, quality engineers, managers and non-technical areas of a business
Knowledgeable in Quality Engineering/Assurance and applying this to websites and web services
Proficient in building and hosting frameworks, tools and services from scratch
Professional in basic cloud computing architecture and services offered by cloud computing providers (AWS)
Data-driven, with an experimental and analytical mindset and proven ability to drive and deliver results independently
Experienced in implementing non-functional test techniques
Focused on engineering excellence using database technologies for querying data
Experienced in using Git to version control code
Following skills are a plus
Experience with test management tools such as TestRail or Atlassian AIO for Jira
Exposure to UI testing of Angular based applications
Keywords: Cloud computing, Automation, Backend, Javascript, Agile, Test planning, HTTP, Selenium, microsoft, JIRA

Job Description:
Contributing to the planning, estimation, and refinement of stories, epics, and design changes as part of an Agile Scrum team.
Building out test plans to cover new areas of functionality, ensuring all necessary testing is performed.
Refining acceptance criteria into testable units and converting those into automated tests that execute efficiently and reliably.
Integrating automated tests with CI/CD pipelines and ensuring successful automation as part of our standard build process.
Occasional manual testing when automation is not an option.
Reporting, reproducing, and helping development resolve defects - emphasis on troubleshooting, root cause analysis, and prevention of similar issues in the future.
Monitoring our results and driving continuous improvement through process changes.
Mentoring and coaching junior engineers.
Contributing to design/code reviews for product and test code.
Required Skills / Experience:
6+ years of experience as a Software Development Engineer in Test (or similar role).
Engineering / Computer science degree or equivalent experience.
Extensive experience test planning and breaking down stories/requirements into testable units.
4+ years of significant test automation work, validating both back-end and front-end interfaces in at least one high-level object-oriented language, including:
Extensive experience automating business logic in the services layer (RESTful API, SDK, or CLI, as appropriate).
Proficiency in validating contract, functionality, correctness, and performance of REST API endpoints.
Familiarity with BDD tools like Cucumber, Jasmine, or equivalent.
Clear understanding of how to manage risk through negative testing, boundary/limits testing, load/soak testing, and other test aspects as appropriate, including system integration, performance/scale, security, and L10N/I18N.
Moderate experience in validation of UI-functionality and rendering, End-to-End testing, and UAT scenarios.
Extensive knowledge of Cypress with demonstratable experience in Protractor / Selenium.
Knowledge of Web Browsers, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, TypeScript, Angular, JSON, XML, integration with APIs, web servers.
Great knowledge of testing design patterns - for example, the Page Object Model.
Database familiarity (types, schemas, SQL queries, basic operations) and ability to incorporate database-side validation into automated tests.
Experience with multithreading, concurrency, SaaS, and multi-tenant architectures.
Proven ability to integrate with and automate using third party APIs (eg, Google, Microsoft, Amazon etc).
Some working knowledge of Microsoft Exchange, Office365, Azure Active Directory, and Windows Server.
Desired Demonstratable Experience:
Working knowledge of public cloud, especially AWS.
Experience developing QA Automation tests and frameworks.
Experience testing fault resilient services.
Experience in working with highly scalable and distributed systems.
Understanding of the network protocols like HTTP, SMTP, POP.
Basic understanding of security protocols like HTTPS, SSL / TLS, SSH.
Other Skills:
Experience with Agile Scrum.
Experience working in DevOps and Continuous Delivery model using Jenkins.
Basic understanding of authorization protocols such as OAuth.
Basic Linux administration.
Bash and PowerShell scripting.
Keywords: Manual testing, Multithreading, XML, Javascript, Active directory, HTML, HTTP, Windows, Selenium, Troubleshooting

Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Salesforce Developer to join our dynamic team. As a Salesforce Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing Salesforce-based solutions that meet the needs of our organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and deliver high-quality Salesforce applications. This role requires a strong understanding of Salesforce development best practices, along with the ability to translate business requirements into scalable and efficient technical solutions.
What You Will Be Doing:
Test end to end use cases and data flow with multiple systems (Salesforce, Integration testing, NetSuite etc).
Must be able to to spearhead this initiative with a right attitude to bring maturity to the Netsuite team s test strategy
Collaborate with stakeholders and end-users to gather requirements, analyze business processes, and document the test scenarios for Regression , Smoke , E2E and Functional testing
Define, build, modify and execute automated tests for regression test coverage of business process testing, utilizing Selenium ,Java
Creating/maintaining automation BDD/TDD frameworks for automating Netsuite Functionalities
Running all automated test scenarios for the program including various scenarios with different outcomes expected.
Supports the introduction, adoption and adherence to new / advanced techniques and approaches in testing and automation
Work with JIRA for automation deliverables, test case management, defect management, test reporting, and other functions
Define, develop and analyze test plans, create and execute tests, communicate issues/findings, manage defects, document test results, generate test reports, conduct release readiness reviews, and review documentation
Participating in our agile development process with our team of Salesforce and other IT developers.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Salesforce releases and features, and proactively suggest ways to leverage them in our organization.
What You Bring Along:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).
5+ Experience in Automating test scenarios , development and maintenance using Selenium and Java
Experience in creating/maintaining automation BDD/TDD framework (Using Cucumber, Maven, TestNG
Has taken on lead role in running complete end to end testing for SIT and UAT project timelines
Experience in manual functional/End to End, regression test design and execution of Salesforce and other SaaS systems
S trong understanding of all NetSuite ERP modules and processes, experience working with all versions of SuiteScript ,NetSuite deployments ,Salesforce Integrations and Lightning
Analyzing requirements and design documents and use cases, in order to develop, modify, execute test scenarios and test cases to ensure functionality is covered.
Maintaining documentation of test results and execution status to communicate to IT stakeholders, PM, BA, Dev, Team Lead
Hands on experience Automating Netsuite and Salesforce applications .
Hands-on experience using tools like Postman, or something similar.
Good knowledge on version control tools such as Git.
Has taken on lead role in running complete end to end testing for SIT and UAT project timelines
Experience with JIRA, Confluence and Testrail
Very good knowledge on QA processes and hands-on experience of preparing testing artifacts such as test plan, strategy, Test cases, status reports.
Well knowledge of Agile principles and the flexibility to adapt the experience to new and evolving environments
Hands on experience in creating Automation Framework and maintenance
Experience in manual functional/End to End, regression test design and execution of Salesforce ,Integration testing, NetSuite etc
Strong understanding of Salesforce capabilities, proven Automation testing experience with Salesforce App, Salesforce Integrations and Lightning
Ensure adherence to quality testing best practices, standards and project deadlines
Strong organizational and analytical skills with attention to detail
Expert level knowledge of the Software Development Lifecycle, Knowledge of Agile development practices and sprint delivery model
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Bonus Points:
Agile experience
Any developer experience on the Netsuite / Salesforce platform or other web application platforms Knowledge of Salesforce environment refresh approaches and best practices
Keywords: Maven, ERP, Functional testing, Agile, Selenium, microsoft, Open source, cisco, CRM, Salesforce

Job Title: Software Engineer in Test - Endpoint agent close To OS
Job Description:
In the New Data subgroup we have the Data Quality Team - the quality gate for the subgroup s part of the Nexthink product
In our part of the product we are all about the data
Our development teams own the components responsible for collecting the data from customers endpoint devices, aggregating the data in the cloud backend and delivering the data to other parts of the product for complex analytics and visualization
As a Software Engineer in Test, you will:
Verify the data quality of new solutions, both experimental and production
Participate in test plans development and execution
Monitor data quality from existing solutions on a wide scale
Participate in Support and Data Quality incidents investigations
Participate in regression tests automation
Together with the Team improve the subgroup Data Quality strategy and tooling
Minimum 5 years of experience in software quality assurance.
Good understanding of Operating Systems internals, preferably Windows and/or macOS.
Experience in desktop applications quality assurance.
Experience in OS-level data quality validation (data about processes, network connections, users, sessions and more) is a huge advantage.
Experience in microservices-based backend quality assurance is a plus.
Confident knowledge of Python and Robot Framework.
Experience with Jenkins or other continuous integration system systems.
Knowledge of test methodologies and their corresponding tools.
Experience and willingness to work in an agile and dynamic environment.
Experience: 5+ yrs mandatory
Keywords: Automation, Backend, Manager Quality Assurance, Agile, Data quality, Windows, Mac Os, Software quality assurance, Analytics, Python

Job Description:
We re looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) who can bring their depth and breadth of experience to help us continue to scale while maintaining high standards for efficiency, quality, performance, integrity, and technical excellence.
Index s scale spans the globe, our transactions happen 24x7 in our global data centers, and every second that passes millions of requests are evaluated across our exchange. In order to achieve our mission, global efficiency and reliability are absolutely key, as every millisecond quite literally counts in our business.
What We re Looking For:
Problem Solvers: You are tenacious at finding solutions and find creative ways to solve problems while working with others amicably and presenting your viewpoints
High Standards: You enjoy designing, writing, and testing high quality scalable code, within a robust CI and CD DevOps tooling culture
Knowledge Hungry: Learning new frameworks and languages is exciting to you - you re not satisfied with the status quo. We use a variety of languages and tools to solve problems and were interested in what youre looking to learn. We re always open to new ideas that s how we got where we are today, and we need more
Here s What You ll be Doing:
You ll be working on cutting edge programmatic ad tech that touches millions of users every single day
Be a key technical member building and supporting our software/data test automation framework and related capabilities
Participate in definition, design, development and maintenance of tools, test cases, and automation frameworks
Team with Product Management, SW Engineering, DevOps, and other technical teams in planning and coordination of test automation initiatives
Interpret functional requirements and designs to plan, develop, write, execute, and automate functional and data validation test plans
Work with engineering and infrastructure teams on strategy and maintenance for required TDD/CI/CD development and test environments
Provide feedback and influence the design process to help us build a testable platform, applications, and data models
Design and build quality, performance, and reliability in from day one, and inspire other team members to do the same
Document and communicate module and automation framework functions, interfaces, performance criteria, test cases, and results to diverse audiences
Conduct defect management activities to include problem identification, issue research, analysis, and documentation
Work closely with the development team for test reviews, issue diagnosis, resolution and closure
Lead or assist in data analysis to determine data health and consistency, or root cause of issues
Heres What You Need:
You are a talented, fast learner and embrace change
3+ years of experience as a Software Engineer
2 years of formal and organized quality assurance testing and automation experience in commercial software environments
Experience designing and building simulation software to validate functionality and performance of end-to-end software solutions
Automated testing and data validation experience for high volume and large data sets
A passion to design, write and test high-quality code. We use a lot of different languages including: JavaScript (namely Angular, Node, React), Perl, Golang, MySQL and more
Experience in algorithms, performance optimization, design patterns and memory optimization
Excellent problem-solving skills, the ability to think differently, and an understanding that compromise, negotiation and practicality are important qualities
A desire to work with and learn from the people around you - we greatly value people and interactions
Knowledge in any of the following are assets:
C++, Python and Scala
Kubernetes, Kafka, Docker, Aerospike
Any other tools or techniques that would make sense for us
Keywords: SAN, C++, Automation, Manager Quality Assurance, Software Development Manager, MySQL, Javascript, Perl, Testing, Python

Job Description:
Review and analyze requirements, technical design documents and provide feedback
Identify and develop detailed and comprehensive test scenarios, test cases and test data
Design and develop automation scripts
Execute manual and automated test cases
Debug failures in test execution and investigate the causes
Identify defects and discrepancies in the application, log them and track throughout their lifecycle
Prepare and maintain the test documentation and quality metrics
Participate in test documentation and automation code reviews
Identify, develop, and execute non-functional test cases
Collaborate and coordinate with developers, other testers, and product owners
Focused on continuous improvement of quality-driven software techniques and processes
Willingness to work flexible hours that works best with the local and remote engineering center(s)
Technical Skills
Strong experience with black box testing of a web applications
Minimum 3 to 6 years of hands-on experience with automation scripting tools like Selenium or Robot Framework, Protractor, Cypress, Playwright etc

Job Description:
Lead one part of a large Agile testing team; Deploy and manage resources for testing
Build a testing team of professionals with appropriate skills, attitudes and motivation
Participate in Requirment Analysis, task management, work breakdown, estimation, scheduling
Design, implement and maintain reusable automated tests
Implement, monitor, and enforce all processes for testing as per standards defined by the organization.
Meet the quality, cost and schedule target for your projects
Idenity, monitor and handle the dependencies and risks
Help the team to troubleshoot the issues. Perform root cause analysis for the major issues.
Ensure content and structure of all testing artifcats are documented and maintained.
Track and report the testing metrics like test case pass results, test case coverage, discovered defects, performance baselines etc
Share ideas to improve test methods and contribute to the reviews
Adhere to development coding standards and recommend continuous improvement of processes for test automation.
Collaborate with project stakeholders across time zones
Keep yourself and the team updated with latest industry developments
What You Need to Succeed
Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Development, or related field.
Work Experience: 8 to 12 years of experience in test automation, with a minimum of 3+ years in test lead role and leading a Test automation team

Experiences in building test automation frameworks with focus on white box testing
Familiarity with best practices in UI test automation and tools like Selenium
Experiences with continuous integration systems and agile methodologies (preferably in Azure DevOps)
Experiance in test design, code review, risk and dependency management
Experience working with code repositories such as GitHub / TFS-GIT
Experience in automated test suite integration with CICD pipelines
Good understanding about testing process, test design techniques, defect management and methodology
Experience in implementing API (e.g.: gRPC / REST) automation using C#
Strong people managment skill to mentor, motivate and get the results from the team
Good Understanding of databases and services
Experiance in working with Global / distributed teamStrong people management skill ?? mentoring, retention, employee engagement, etc
Strong exposure to Development life cycle, testing life cycle and agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban etc.)
Fluent in English (oral and written)

Familiarity with advanced concepts of computer architecture, microservices (load balancers, caching, web servers, application servers, networking), data structures and standard programming practices

Job Title: SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER IN TEST II (SDET II)
Job Description:
As a member of the Software Quality Assurance (QA) team, the Software Development Engineer in Test II will be responsible for ensuring quality throughout the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC) and performing systematic software testing via manual testing and test automation to ensure flawless delivery. The candidate will be responsible for writing and executing manual and automation test plans and test cases for all applicable test levels, reporting, and tracking defect resolution. The chosen candidate will be involved in the full SDLC from requirement reviews through release and post-live validation and will document deliverable artifacts collaborating with Software Engineers, Project Managers, and product stakeholders.
Duties & Responsibilities
Develop, debug, and maintain both manual and automated test scripts and test cases
Maintain manual and automated smoke/regression tests and create new feature test cases
Report defects for code errors that are found during test runs
Generate reports that reflect quality metrics and KPIs from manual and automated test runs
Identifying and removing risks to quality for our software applications
Contributing to a Scrum team that solves complex challenges and builds working software
Identifying and resolving software inconsistencies, ambiguities and defects during the design and implementation phase of software building
Carrying out root cause analysis on defects to ensure fixes are happening in the right way
Ensuring proper communication on risks to quality
Adhering to standard operating procedures and the collection of measures put in place to ensure consistency and improvement in the way we test software
Contributing to the planning process to establish tasks and forecast work to be performed

Required Skills and Experience

Job Title: Staff Software Development Engineer in Test, Cloud Firewall
Job Description:
The delivers Firewall as a Service (FWaaS) for egress traffic as part of SASE architecture
Users and offices connect to NewEdge, the largest private security cloud in the world for firewall protection
With Cloud Firewall, organizations improve their security posture, while reducing operational costs compared to traditional hardware appliances
Whats in it for you
You will be a member of the Quality engineering team using state of the art tools and technologies to test, qualify and benchmark a performant and scalable system that processes customer traffic at cloud-scale
As a QE engineer you should understand the technology, customer usecases, and come up with a robust test plan which covers functionality, E2E and solution test scenarios
You will also automate all variations of testsl
You will participate in design discussions, understand usecases, provide feedback at solution level, challenge the design to think about corner cases etc
What you will be doing
Involve in requirements/design discussions with Product managers & development team.
Design test plans & test strategy documents for the Netskope solutions/features and closely work with the development team to cover all aspects of the features being developed.
Execution of tests and reporting.
Development of automation scripts in parallel to feature development to enable CI/CD. (i.e Day0 Automation)
Identify, evaluate and propose new test tools for improving product testing.
Work closely with the technical support team to handle customer escalations by reproducing the issues internally. Analyze the test gaps that resulted in customer issues and improve test plan/strategy.
E2E ownership from feature testing to production deployment to monitoring & alerting.
Identify gaps in the regression test automation and improve automation coverage.
Required skills and experience
Extensive and good knowledge of TCP/IP and HTTP/S and proficient with L4-L7 protocols.
Must have experience in SWG/WebProxy, SSL/IPSec/GRE & Network/Application Security/Firewalls.
Strong expertise in Python automation & building test frameworks.
Cloud Technology (Docker, Kubernetes, Opensource technologies).
Strong expertise in RESTful Web Service automation
Good working experience in CI/CD.
System/server side experience for troubleshooting.
Technical know-how of build and repo management tools with overall testing cycle.
Self-starter with desire to work in a fast paced environment with cross-timezone teams.
Candidate should have an attitude of go and get it done and should exhibit it in day-2-day work
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Bonus points for experience with Ansible, Kubernetes, SQL and NoSQL datastores, CI/CD, Jenkins
Education
BE in CS or equivalent required, ME/M Tech/MS in CS or equivalent strongly preferred
Keywords: Automation, Test planning, HTTP, Troubleshooting, SSL, Technical support, Monitoring, SQL, Python, Firewall

Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a positive attitude.

Job Title: Lead Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated individual to join our team as a Lead Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET)
As the Lead SDET, you will be responsible for setting up automation pipelines for the execution of tests, ensuring comprehensive coverage of test scenarios, and analyzing the performance of the backend through load and pressure tests
Your day-to-day activities will also include automating back-end and front-end tests, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and setting up automation pipelines to evaluate LLMs (Large Language Models), benchmark them, and conduct/execute necessary types of tests
As a Lead Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) you will...
Develop and implement automation frameworks and pipelines for the execution of tests, ensuring efficient and reliable test coverage across various software components and systems.
Design and execute test plans, test cases, and test scenarios, focusing on both functional and non-functional aspects, including performance, scalability, and reliability.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, data scientists, and product managers, to understand system requirements and ensure that test cases cover the full range of scenarios.
Automate front-end tests using frameworks and tools such as Selenium, Cypress, or Puppeteer, ensuring a seamless and integrated testing process.
Set up automation pipelines to evaluate LLMs, benchmark their performance, and conduct load and performance tests to assess their capabilities and scalability.
Analyze test results, identify defects and areas for improvement, and work closely with development teams to ensure timely resolution of issues.
Monitor and analyze the performance of backend systems through load and pressure tests, identifying bottlenecks, optimizing resource utilization, and improving system scalability.
Continuously enhance and expand the test suite by incorporating new test cases, test data, and test methodologies, with a focus on maintaining test reliability and efficiency.
Collaborate with DevOps and infrastructure teams to integrate automated testing into the CI/CD pipeline, ensuring the seamless execution of tests at every stage of software development.
Stay up-to-date with the latest testing tools, methodologies, and industry best practices, and drive the adoption of new technologies to improve testing efficiency and effectiveness.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior SDETs and testers, fostering a culture of continuous learning, innovation, and quality assurance excellence.
As a Lead Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) you will need...
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field. A Masters degree is preferred.
Proven experience as an SDET, software tester, or in a related quality assurance role, with a focus on test automation and performance testing.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or C#, and experience with test automation frameworks and tools (e.g., Selenium, Cypress, JUnit, TestNG).
Experience with load testing and performance testing tools such as JMeter, Gatling, or K6, and the ability to design and execute comprehensive performance test scenarios.
Solid understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript), front-end frameworks, and API testing methodologies.
Familiarity with AI models and LLMs, and the ability to set up automated testing pipelines to evaluate their performance and scalability.
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, DevOps principles, and experience with tools like Jenkins, Git, or Docker for integration of automated tests.
Knowledge and hands-on experience in Cloud Platforms (AWS and GCP).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex systems and identify areas for improvement and optimization.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams and convey technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Leadership experience or the ability to lead and mentor a team of SDETs and testers is preferred.
Keywords: Manager Quality Assurance, Testing tools, Software Development Manager, Javascript, HTML, Selenium, Test cases, Customer service, CRM, Python

Our Product and Technology team is autonomous and co-functional, operating in an agile devops environment with a strong customer focus

Job Description:
This position will function as a member of the Software Testing team in the SWX organization at Stellantis. We are looking for an experienced candidate to take-up this exciting hands-on technical role. The candidate s responsibilities will consist of working on testing the vehicle smart cockpit (infotainment) software. The primary duties include testing features and services to support the vehicle infotainment software based on test cases derived from requirements. The candidate will work closely with other teams that are responsible for developing and integrating the base software, the application software, test platform, and the continuous integration (CI) platform.
The ideal candidate will possess hands-on experience in the development and testing of embedded software for automotive infotainment applications. The job requires prior experience in embedded software development, and experience in testing. It also requires familiarity with Yocto Linux as well as familiarity with Android code. It is expected that this person possesses an interest in learning and in contributing to the state-of-the-art and emerging automotive computational technologies.
Necessary Skills to Succeed in this Position
Bachelor s in Electrical and Computer Engineering. Other related engineering degrees will also be considered.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in software development, and testing, using C or C++.
Minimum of 4 years of experience in software testing in the Linux environment and involving Yocto.
Familiarity with the software of automotive in-vehicle applications that include one or more of the following application areas: Instrument Clusters, Android applications, Streaming Services, Navigation Services, Vehicle Services, Voice Services, and firmware over the air (FOTA).
Familiarity with rapid prototyping and with board bring-up
Knowledge in hardware interfaces (e.g. CAN, CAN-FD, LIN, Ethernet, Bluetooth, USB)
Possess strong initiative, problem solving skills, and ability to work in a diverse team environment, good at documenting the software
Has good communication skills and the ability to interface with application software developers, vehicle integration and validation engineering organizations.
Ways to Stand out Above the Rest
Experience working within an Agile/Scrum software development process
Experience working with continuous integration systems and ALM tools and script automation
Experience with Ethernet networking protocols such as 802.3, 802.1AS, TSN, and requisite transport layer formats
Experience with industry cryptographic protocols, key handling, chain of trust processing, and anti-spoofing techniques
Experience with working on various CPU architectures, microcontrollers and microprocessors
Familiarity of Automotive Product Development Process like ASPICE, V-model
Experience with power management, board diagnostics, fault management or failure modes
Experience working on embedded target platform services like diagnostics, logging Tracing, client-server other IPC mechanisms, industry benchmarks and their application to measurement and competitive analyses of performance KPIs
Experience with platform services like power management, state management, health management (watchdogs, power health monitoring), and reset handlers
Familiarity with frameworks Test automation unit test frameworks
Experience with automated build and test automation systems
Keywords: C++, Bluetooth, Linux, USB, Ethernet, Firmware, Test cases, Monitoring, Automotive, Android

Job Title: Software Development Engineer in Test (AI SaaS Company)
Job Description:
As a Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at SkyPoint AI, youll play a pivotal role in ensuring the quality and reliability of our Data AI SaaS platform. Your mission will be to design, implement, and maintain automated testing frameworks, collaborate with cross-functional teams, and drive innovation in our testing processes. If youre a problem-solving wizard with a zeal for delivering top-notch automation solutions, this role is made for you!
A Day in the Life
Collaborate with software developers, AI engineers, product managers, and other stakeholders to understand product requirements and translate them into test strategies and plans.
Design, develop, and maintain automated test frameworks, tools, and test suites to ensure efficient and reliable software testing.
Write and execute complex automation test cases, perform thorough regression testing, and analyze automation test results to identify and report defects.
Collaborate with development teams to promote testability, provide input on architectural design, and implement testability features.
Conduct performance, load, and stress testing to evaluate system performance and scalability.
Identify areas for test process improvement, drive test automation initiatives, and implement best practices to enhance overall testing efficiency and effectiveness.
Investigate and troubleshoot complex technical issues, working closely with development teams to ensure timely resolution.
Establish and enforce quality standards, processes, and guidelines throughout the software development lifecycle.
Mentor and provide technical guidance to junior team members, assisting in their professional growth and development.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in software testing and quality assurance.
Work on new technical solutions to improve automation framework and increase test productivity.
Location: Global Technology Park, Bellandur, Bangalore, India (Hybrid)

What You Need
Bachelors degree in Computer Science from a top tier school with 2+ years of experience working as an SDET for SaaS products.
Strong programming skills in one or more languages, such as Python, C#, or JavaScript.
Extensive experience with test automation frameworks (e.g., Selenium, BDD, Azure DevOps) and related tools.
Proficiency in building and maintaining automated test scripts, test suites, and test data.
Solid understanding of software testing principles, methodologies, and best practices.
Experience with continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) processes and tools (e.g., Azure DevOps CI/CD).
Knowledge of API testing tools and techniques, such as Karate, REST Assured, or similar.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to debug complex issues and propose effective solutions.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.
Education:
B.E/ B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering from top-tier school (IITs, RECs, etc.).
Keywords: Manager Quality Assurance, Testing tools, Javascript, Healthcare, Selenium, Test cases, software quality, microsoft, Analytics, Python

Job Description:
Databases must keep going no matter what. At Cockroach Labs, quality is our number one feature. We are software engineers on a mission to push our product to new frontiers. Our work has a broad-reaching impact on the engineering organisation of over 100 engineers who rely on our tools and methodology to ship a top-notch quality product.
Test Engineering is expanding our investment in next-generation test automation and bug-finding techniques, utilising both randomised and deterministic testing. Note that this is not a QA/manual testing role; all Cockroach Labs engineers write tests and obsess about quality. Test Engineering is a cross-functional team that aims to enable and strengthen the engineering organisation by emphasising correctness and performance testing.
The work encompasses three primary focus areas: Test Infrastructure, Exploratory Testing, and Performance and Scalability. Speaking broadly, Test Infrastructure enables automated test execution, detection of performance regressions, fuzzing, and much more. Exploratory Testing enables new bug-finding techniques such as static and dynamic analysis, metamorphic testing, failure injection, and others. Performance and Scalability enables at-scale benchmarking.
Some examples of recent and future projects:
framework utilising and
Failure injection testing (e.g., , )
Next generation of and
Parallelised automated microbenchmarks via
Developing a static analysis framework for concurrency bugs
Large-scale benchmarking and performance testing
Automated flaky test detection and quarantining
The ideal candidate will have worked with massively complex codebases and possesses broad experience in distributed systems, cloud infrastructure, and automated testing.
You Will
Develop test strategies and methodologies.
Build and scale test infrastructure.
Build tools and frameworks to find bugs in complex distributed systems.
Build static and dynamic analysers.
Perform at-scale cloud benchmarking.
Prioritise and execute test suites that are representative of customers workloads.
The Expectations
In your first 30 days, you will become an integrated member of our engineering team. You ll become familiar with our production systems, software development workflows, and the architectures of CockroachDB and CockroachDB Cloud. We believe that it s essential for you to take the first month to get to know our technology and our company. You ll work on a starter project to help you learn about a particular area and start to get the lay of the land.
After your first month, you will align with the team s development objectives and own a medium-sized project to completion.
By the end of the third month, you will be a fully contributing member of the Test Engineering team. You will also have developed enough familiarity with our engineering processes to propose and scope future projects.

Test Case Design: Create detailed test cases and test scripts based on software requirements and design specifications
These test cases outline specific steps to be executed during testing
Manual Testing: Execute manual testing processes by following test cases, conducting functional testing, regression testing, integration testing, and user acceptance testing (UAT)
Manually identify and report defects or issues
Automation Testing: Depending on the project, develop and maintain automated test scripts using test automation tools like Selenium, Appium, or others
Automation testing is particularly useful for repetitive and regression testing
Test Data Preparation: Create or obtain test data sets required for testing scenarios, ensuring they cover various use cases and edge cases
Defect Reporting: Document and report defects or issues found during testing, including detailed descriptions, steps to reproduce, and severity assessments
Collaborate with developers to resolve issues
Keywords: QA, Automation, Manual

Job Description:
Sitero is an emerging leader in Clinical services and software solutions for the life sciences industry
We have experience and expertise in diverse therapeutic areas and focus on innovative, technology-enabled solutions that allow our clients to focus on their core strengths
For early phase studies through Phase III clinical trials, our experienced team delivers high-touch services and technology to ensure the safety of all stakeholders across the clinical research community, emphasizing ethics, compliance, and innovation
As a Software Test Automation Engineer, your role is to write scripts and create automation environments for repeated tests
You will design, test, and deploy effective test automation solutions using different automation tools
Your goal is to automate as much of the testing effort as possible with a minimum set of code
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Previous experience as a test automation engineer.
Excellent mathematical and problem-solving skills.
Highly accurate and detail-oriented.
5+ years of hands-on quality assurance work with web-based applications
Experience testing web/eCommerce applications constructed using modern web frameworks such as React, node, typescript, and related technologies
Familiarity with emerging web platform best practices, including progressive web applications, service workers, network optimization, and performance optimization
Excellent Java programming and debugging skills, including experience with test automation tools and libraries such as Selenium, TestNG, Jest, and JMeter
Secure API testing experience
Selenium (or similar robust toolkit) testing experience
EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
Engineering degree in Computer science/ software development, or similar.
5~8 years Prior experience automation test engineer.
Continuous Integration tools - Jenkins, Bit bucket, Github JIRA - Defect tracking and task creation tool
Advanced proficiency in Java.
A flair for creating well-presented software that is technically sound.
Outstanding analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
Excellent organizational and time management skills.
Self-driven, flexible, and innovative.
Keywords: Automation, Manager Quality Assurance, Defect tracking, Analytical, Debugging, Clinical research, Life sciences, Selenium, JIRA

Job Description:
Meraki is looking for a Software QA Engineer to join to support system test qualification of our SD-WAN product offerings
As a Software QA Engineer for System Test, your responsibility includes crafting and building testbeds, creating and implementing the integrated/application tests that resemble customer use-case for SD-WAN and Security solutions over physical, cloud, on-prem MX products and Meraki Dashboard, and contributing to industry-leading technologies in the cloud ecosystem
As a part of a geographically distributed team, you will collaborate with multiple Meraki engineering teams and partners around the globe
To be successful in this role, you will need to have motivation, curiosity, passion for problem-solving, and experience with telco technologies and automation as a breath
In addition to driving test strategy, test planning and performing testing on large-scale networks you will involve in implementing new ideas to optimize and improvements
What You Will Be Doing
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the use cases/workflows of the MX and vMX solution deployed in the customer environment.
Participate in requirements/design discussions with Product managers development team.
Craft a test strategy document for the Meraki MX and vMX features and collaborate with other QA and development teams to cover all aspects of the features being developed.
Execution of tests and reporting test results, and test metrics pertaining to these tests.
Develop automation scripts in parallel or ahead with feature testing to enable CI/CD (ie Automation Driven Testing)
Participate in exploring new test tools for improving system-level product testing.
Participate in analyzing the test gaps that resulted in customer issues and incorporate them into the test strategy.
Be collaborative with Senior engineers / Leads in developing test-plan and reviewing your work.
Invest in innovation and out-of-the-box thinking to foster the originality of ideas to productize them.
What You Will Be Bringing
Bachelor s / Master of Science Degree in Computer Science (or equivalent or a related field, or equivalent experience)
4+ years of experience in Software Quality assurance with at least 1+ years of System testing or integration testing experience in large-scale routing, switching and wireless domain.
Good knowledge of SDWAN, Security, Layer-2(VLAN/802.1Q) or Layer-3 (BGP/IP/OSPF/VPN/IPSec/NAT) and are at ease to ramp up quickly on new technologies and concepts.
Proficiency in writing quality code with one of the programming or scripting languages such as Ruby, Python, and Golang.
Knowledge with any one of Cloud or Containerized platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, ESXi, NSX-T, OpenStack, Kubernetes, Dockers, etc
Good understanding of customer deployments and applying those findings to in-house testing and validations.
Understanding of traffic generators and ability to explore tools and techniques to improve the testing methodology. Willing to explore virtual environments.
Knowledge of end-to-end testing of embedded devices at the system test level
Practical communication skills and proven track record of collaboration with stakeholders.
What makes you stand out
The ability to relate everyday work to the strategic vision of the feature, platform, domain and enterprise teams, with a strong focus on business outcomes
Ability to communicate sophisticated technical concepts clearly to peers and management
Research of applications and Framework experience - Acquired patent(s), Published White paper / Yellow paper on embedded solutions
Hands-on experience with Cloud and Containerized platforms such as AWS, GCP, Azure, AliCloud, Kubernetes, Dockers, etc
Experience with Automation framework development
Experience with developing frameworks for CI/CD pipeline
Keywords: Networking, WAN, VPN, VLAN, cisco, Ruby, Software quality assurance, Python, OSPF

Job Description:
Well versed with manual Testing concept and experience in testing complex, multi-tiered web-based systems and complex data-driven applications.
Must have hands on experience in developing Test Cases from Requirement, Specific Scenario, Use Cases and Optimize Test coverage
Experience in developing Test Automation with Selenium, Soap UI or similar tools using Python, C#, Java, Scripting.
Experience in mobile applications, Desktop, Web, Android and iOS
Experience with Industrial Automation technologies involving PLC / AC Drives / Industrial Robots
Experience Testing software involving different protocols like EtherNet/IP, MODBUS TCP, Modbus, BLE, RS232/RS422/RS485 Serial Communication, CAN Open
Work experience with agile is preferred

Must able to drive Manual Test execution and contribute in automation Testing
Analyze the system requirement
Author test specifications by understanding the customer/system requirements
Test script development and Execution
Test scenario (input) creation
Test analysis, report major findings internally and preparation of supportive documents on need basis Document detailed test design, analysis and reports

Job Title: Sr. Software Test Engineer - Automation with C#
Job Description:
As a member of the Testing team, you will be responsible for the design, development, and maintenance of modular, extensible, and reusable test cases/scripts. In this role, you will be integrated with an engineering team and will partner with other team members to drive quality best practices into the application development process.
Promoting continuous improvement, youll identify opportunities to maximize the customer experience and reduce the test cycle time by improving techniques, and tooling, eliminating waste, and creating a collaborative, proactive approach to quality.

Job Responsibilities:
Agile cross-functional development team - designing, developing, testing features as a team.
Provide technical excellence, leadership and experience to the testing team for automation of software products including:
Automation development best practices
Coding best practices
Continuous integration
Agile development methods
Behavior Driven Development
Writing automation test scripts using test automation frameworks and tools
Working with colleagues to improve the automated test coverage
Working with developers at design stage to assess functional and non-functional automation requirements
Working with the product management team to influence the future roadmap of the product and ensure testability is part of the product backbone
Writing and coding automated tests in .NET C# in line with test scripts
Investigate, analyse and fix failing testing in automation or raise required bugs in product
Assist the test team with manual testing when necessary
Advise on product improvements to accelerate automated testing
Create, document, and implement tests scripts, automated tests and test harnesses.
Provide training and technical guidance to other members of the test team
Always ensure that the automation solutions you develop are resilient, stable, fit for purpose, reusable, and maintainable
Be responsible for providing estimates for work to be done within the backlog
Ensure that the design, build, integrate, test and QA phases are completed in accordance with the project plan
Understanding the product and becoming an expert resource of knowledge in how it works
Analysis and testing of hardware integrations from the software product to third party devices
Provide accurate estimates for automation development, bug fixes and other tasks as part of the Sprint planning process
Working with the infrastructure provided, perform load testing and advise colleagues where this could be improved
Continuously look for ways to improve the reliability, innovation and solution roadmap for automation
Ensure that automation is reviewed at timely intervals
Required Skills:
Degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent work experience
At least 3 years experience of test automation with Specflow, Selenium/Winium and C#
At least 5 years experience of test automation
Experience with various QA methods and tools
Experience with creating and executing test cases
Experience of designing and building high availability, resilient automation solutions
Experience of Behaviour Driven Development
At least 2 years experience in Agile methods and delivery
Great contributor to cross-functional agile development team
Ability to work effectively under strict time constraints and customer deadlines
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Able to work in a fast-moving environment and pragmatic approach to changing priorities
Object oriented design and implementation
Excellent communication and time management skills
Attention to detail and ownership of issues
Good to have skills:
Experience in the Physical Security industry
Knowledge and experience of security hardware - DVRs, Cameras, Access control, IoT etc
ISEB/ISTQB Foundation Level Certification
Test automation experience with Windows Desktop applications
",
Keywords: Product management, Computer science, Object oriented design, Manual testing, Load testing, Test scripts, Coding, Application development, Windows, Selenium

Job Description:
We are hiring Test Automation Experts with knowledge and experience in networking or security or storage domain. Candidate should have experience in GUI test automation using Selenium or similar tools, CLI/REST API/System level test automation using Python or any other scripting languages and should possess a deeper understanding of RD Software/Product Engineering operations. Should be passionate in test automation development and exhibit great attitude commitment towards work.
Qualifications Preferred:
Typically requires Masters/Bachelors in ECE/CS combined with 1-3 years industry experience. Networking or Storage or Security certification(s) preferred. Must be proficient in English language (both written and oral communication).
Skills Preferred:
Software testing development concepts (STLC, SDLC), Test Automation, Python/PERL/Shell/C Language, OS (Linux, Windows), Low-level Code/System level manual testing GUI automation, OSI, TCP/IP, Networking, Storage, File System, IO, Switching/Routing Protocols, Cloud Networking, WAN/LAN, SDN, etc.
Roles Responsibilities:
Play a crucial role in developing software test automation ecosystem
Automate manual test cases regularly in a reliable way to test product
Work with developers, testers, management to increase test efficiency
Learn new products, technologies, features and create automation suites
Develop framework and APIs on need basis to expand test coverage
Assess various testing/traffic tools and integrate with automation infra
Keywords: Automation, Manual testing, Linux, WAN, LAN, Perl, Windows, SDLC, Python

Job Description:
As a Software Development Engineer in Test, you will write scripts for our Trusted Media Brands websites, ecommerce platforms, APIs, and RIFF applications
You will ensure that the automation scripts you write verify our sites to ensure that defects do not get released to production environments
The candidate will directly report to Automation QA Manager
We are looking for a skilled candidate with good experience in automation QA
Your day to day:
You will write test scripts using the available framework for the tickets assigned to you in each sprint
You will attend all the sprint meetings to understand the business requirements
You will monitor the test script execution on Jenkins and Gitlab pipelines
You will interact with the developers and product owners to gain understanding of what to script for a given ticket
You will suggest any improvements based on your previous experience
You will monitor the daily pipelines
You have:
4-6 years of experience in Automation testing
Strong problem-solving skills
Experience in working in an agile system
Ability to deliver on time quality automation testing scripts
Experience in automation testing tools like selenium, rest-assured, testNg, Cucumber
Experience in building a framework from scratch
Experience is building efficient CI/CD pipeline
Ability to maintain a project as a sole contributor
Experience in playwright or any other js bases automation testing framework and knowledge of PHP and groovy is plus
India specific benefits
Comprehensive Time Off policies
Maternity and Paternity Time off
Health Insurance, Accidental Insurance* & Wellness Benefits including access to OPD consultations*, Gym/Yoga studios, Teleconsultation/Telemedicine*
Access to Mental Health Reimbursement
Annual Sport reimbursement and Home office reimbursement

Job Description:
The Software Engineer ,D&T,Automation Testing requires good knowledge and expertise to assist in the product planning, designing test suites, defining automation testing strategies and execution of testing across different products
Core part of Software engineering team, responsible for end-to-end product quality and automating as much as testing efforts with respect to functional, User Interface, Load and Performance Test
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Good understanding of the overall vision, product road maps, business needs and the solution architecture across different products. Uses this knowledge to solve complex problems.
Assist in end-to-end testing in an Agile methodology with Azure DevOps / Visual Studio Team Services (VSTS).
Helps to set up Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Delivery (CD) using Azure DevOps for all Automated Test Tools.
Assist the Sr. Engineer to develop test case, prioritizes test cases and configures test automation framework and executes functional stability and performance tests.
With guidance execute testing throughout the product development lifecycle and sharing testing status reports across engineering team.
Defines and executes Manual Test cases during early stage of product development using Azure DevOps Test Plan and Test Suites.
Enables Manual Testing as minimum and driving product testing in a repeatable automated manner.
Assist in managing Automation Testing Framework across Web Platform, Mobility Platform and API Level.
Coordinates with product owner and software engineering team to deliver stable enterprise software products with high quality.
Estimates technical requirements and breaks down work to user stories and tasks for automation testing
Plans, tests, deploys and monitors cloud-based solution in a DevOps model.
Collaborates with senior roles and Architects on various prototypes, or proof of concept, to test solutions
Azure Automation, Azure Monitor, Log Analytics services, Identify crash log for mobile based solutions.
Other duties as assigned.
Education and Experience:
Bachelor s degree or equivalent experience
Minimum 3-5 years of experience .
Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Experience with authoring functional and non-functional test cases.
Exceptional knowledge on capturing NFRs
Experience and Good knowledge in the following:
Automation testing using HP ALM
Knowledge in creating test plans, test execution using Azure Test Plan Suites with the power of Azure DevOps
Knowledge of C# / Python programming language and Azure cloud technologies
Understanding of Azure DevOps / VSTS for Build, Automation and overall Testing Strategies
Familiar with of TestNG/Junit, Ant/Maven and Jenkins build and release pipelines
Experience is Native Mobile App Testing using Automation, Familiar with HockeyApp Crash Analytics, and Visual Studio App Center
Knowledge in log analysis from Azure Application Insights, and Kudu logs.
Knowledge on Selenium/Appium and BDD Tools
Experience in designing, building test automation frameworks for REST APIs and UI based testing
Experiences in Load Test using Visual Studio and Azure DevOps
Performance Testing using Azure DevOps Suites, identify performance test metrics and provide recommendation.
Preferred:
o 3+ years of experiences in Automation Testing (2+ years with Selenium / C# / Azure DevOps)
o Development experiences with .NET, C#, ASP.NET MVC with other Microsoft Tools and Technologies
Ability to work in a global and virtual environment and to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Physical and Travel Requirements
10% travel, including global travel
Occasional on-call work required
Prefer 12pm - 9pm India time. Willingness to work outside of these hours as needed.
Keywords: Maven, Automation testing, Healthcare, Test planning, Selenium, Visual Studio, Test cases, microsoft, Analytics, Python

Deep focus on building automation framework for all product features & APIs and ensuring every test cases is automated.

Extensive knowledge in web and Mobile Apps (Android & iOS) testing

Job Description:
FUSIONSTAK
Job Title: Software Tester
Experience: Min 2 Years in Testing
Location: Pune
Salary: Best in industry
Notice Period: Immediate Joiners(preferred) or less than 30 days
About Us:
Fusionstak is a pioneering Cloud-based technology product and services company known for its agility and innovation. With a relentless commitment to staying at the forefront of the ever-evolving technology landscape, Fusionstak empowers clients to thrive in a dynamic marketplace. Our expertise fuels the rapid delivery of cutting-edge IT solutions to forward-thinking customers worldwide.
At Fusionstak, we excel in addressing diverse application development requirements. Whether it's bespoke software development, adept data management, seamless legacy system conversion and migration, sophisticated data modelling, efficient big data management, or harnessing the power of cloud services, we are the trusted partner for next-gen businesses seeking transformative solutions.
Our customer-centric approach ensures that we not only meet but exceed our clients' expectations, enabling them to remain at the pinnacle of their industries. Fusionstak is dedicated to driving innovation, and we look forward to continually shaping the technology landscape alongside our clients.
Job Description:
Fusionstak is actively seeking a Full Stack Developer with a minimum of 2 years of experience to join our team within the next 10-15 days. As a crucial member of our team, you'll serve as a Software Tester, working collaboratively with development teams to ensure the quality and reliability of our software products. Your role involves identifying, documenting, and assisting in resolving defects, ensuring our software adheres to the highest standards of functionality, usability, and performance. Join us to contribute your expertise and be a vital part of our commitment to delivering top-notch software solutions.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with project managers and developers to understand project requirements and timelines.
Create detailed test plans, test cases, and test scripts based on project specifications.
Define test objectives, scope, and success criteria.
Execute test cases manually and/or using automated testing tools.
Identify, isolate, and document software defects, and track them to resolution.
Perform regression testing to ensure that fixed defects do not reappear.
Develop and maintain automated test scripts using testing frameworks and tools.
Continuously enhance test automation coverage for efficient regression testing
Generate comprehensive test reports that include test results, defect status, and recommendations.
Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of test cases and procedures.
Collaborate with developers, product managers, and other stakeholders to prioritize and resolve issues.
Participate in project meetings to provide testing updates and insights.
Conduct performance testing to assess software scalability, load handling, and response times.

Qualifications:
B/Tech in Computer Science OR Information Technology.
Minimum of 2 year of experience in software testing in an IT industry environment.
Strong knowledge of software testing concepts, methodologies, and tools.
Proficiency in test case design and execution.
Familiarity with bug tracking and test management tools (e.g., JIRA, TestRail).
Basic understanding of programming languages (e.g., Java, Python) for test automation
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Keywords: Mobile Testing, Manual Testing, Selenium, Functional Testing, Security Testing, Java, Performance Testing, Web Application Testing, JIRA, Cucumber, Test Cases
